story:
Just a short Video and a few pics from a recent storm chase

A word from Joe and the RDR Team

I appreciate all of the help you many others have provided thus far. I have been pounding the pavement for months now but the area I live in and surrounding communities are slow to react to this. Disasters of the level Rapid Disaster Relief wants to deploy for rarely happen here and most of the people I talk to I have to educate on what the Red Cross and FEMA do and where Rapid Disaster Relief fits in. Most of the responses I get are "we have the Red Cross and my tax dollars go for FEMA". When we get those responses I sit with them and show them the void that Rapid Disaster Relief will fill. By the consistent effort of the team,we are getting close to our goal and I hope to find more funding to get multiple setups going. I really don't think there is a "right way" to explain the Red Cross and FEMA's issuses without sounding like we are diminishing or "bashing" them, because we are in NO WAY doing that.

This may sound a little odd but when all of the storms hit during the last two weeks , I was getting frustrated while watching the news reports. The Red Cross did a great job responding but still wasn't enough. They are doing way too many tasks at a disaster to be fully efficient. In the North Carolina disaster it took them longer to get shelter up because they were trying to get the food, water, clothing and medical services going. The storms in MS, AR and OK last week  were the same result. I don't want to include this when I am presenting Rapid Disaster Relief because I never want it to sound like we are diminishing the Red Cross because they do an amazing job. What Rapid Disaster Relief is doing is helping them and other relief efforts be better equipped and more successful at each disaster site. We're not trying to reinvent the wheel, Rapid Disaster Relief is just trying to perfect it.


Purpose of the Rapid Disaster Relief (R.D.R.)

The purpose of Rapid Disaster Relief is to relieve human suffering caused by natural disasters by providing a 12,000 sq. ft. air supported structure that will be operated via solar and wind turbine power and have a backup generator with an auto switch to maintain constant power. The structure will house 500 cots for disaster victims as well as a Red Cross station inside for their first responders. R.D.R. will also provide satellite television for local and national news and satellite internet for the disaster victims to stay in communication with family members via a bank of laptops located  inside the structure. We will also provide shower stations as well as porta-potties. This structure will also provide an area for other relief groups to have a command center to aid in their efforts as well. 

We will be working with various disaster organizations and local authorities in order to achieve this goal: American Red Cross, The Salvation Army, Church organizations and a variety of groups.

Rapid Disaster Relief Flowchart


   Our Shelters will also be used as a hub to centrally locate supplies and help in one location.

  We will work hand in hand with other relief efforts to house not only disaster victims but food, water, clothing and other personal necessities.  


Motivation of Rapid Disaster Relief (R.D.R.)

To provide physical, emotional, and spiritual help to victims of natural and man-made disasters, including floods, earthquakes, hurricanes, tornadoes, and fires in the United States. Our primary goal is to provide assistance to anyone that is in distress due to a disaster. At every opportunity we must ensure that each person that we have contact with feels safe and secure during this terrifying time in their life. Well, just how do we define a disaster?  A disaster is anything that causes human suffering or creates human needs that the victims cannot alleviate themselves. More than likely, you or someone you know has been in that position.


Mission Statement

The goal of Rapid Disaster Relief is to provide an immediate shelter to people in need due to disasters. We seek to provide organization, equipment, and strategy for committed volunteers and paid employees to help affected individuals/families in their worst time of need. Some of the other ways we respond are through; Administration, Assessment, Communications, Childcare, Help in Search and Rescue, Laundry (Tide Trucks), Logistics, Mass feeding (supplied by other Disaster groups), Recovery (debris removal), Shower, Water, etc. 

The question is not whether a disaster will occur in your region—it is a question of when it will strike. Disasters don’t always occur on weekdays between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m.  R.D.R. will be prepared to travel day or night to respond to the need of the community affected. We will be located near developing storms so we can deploy our structure immediately. The R.D.R. team will be traveling and staying in an R.V. along with a semi-truck and trailer. We will be staying at truck stops to keep cost expenditures to a minimum so we can maximize the use of the donation dollars.

The Personal Motivation

The concept for Rapid Disaster Relief was inspired years ago while storm-chasing.  Over time, something that began as a past-time for an amateur enthusiast quickly spawned a desire to help those caught up in the destruction and aftermath of these storms.  Traveling from town-to-town following weather patterns for sheer excitement soon faded into a somber realization that the people I saw couldn't just move on to the next place once the storm was over.  Life for them continued on in devastation long after the footage stopped.  Words can't begin to describe the feelings you experience when you see families standing out in front of what used to be their dream homes, holding each other.  Others frantically calling out for help trying to find their loved ones, climbing over debris.  Seeing entire families standing along the side of the road with nothing but a duffel bag with a change of clothes, realizing that they have no place to go.  A man clinching the shoulder of his wife, holding his screaming child in his arms trying to convince them as well as himself that everything will be ok.  The look of utter hopelessness across his face as he fights back his tears to be strong for his family The rubble behind them representing only a fraction of what they truly lost.  And knowing that they were the lucky ones.

It is because of experiences like these that I am so passionate about helping the victims of disasters.  To provide them with a place to go and let the people they love know that they are all right while they try to figure out what to do next. 

While our initial plan is to establish one set-up to respond to disasters, moving from one location to the next as needed, in the long term we hope to build a fleet ready to go anywhere in the country whenever needed as we gain funding and staffing.  Our long-term goal will allow for shelters to be in use for longer durations while more permanent accommodations can be made as well as allowing us to respond to disasters in various parts of the country at the same time.  While no one really knows where disasters will hit, we hope to provide victims with the answer "Where will we go?"

2014 Disaster Relief Training 

Preparation is the best form of disaster response. All members of the R.D.R. Disaster Relief Team will go through our required training and Red Cross First Aid training before being allowed on site. You don't have to be trained to participate in some portions of our response, however, we highly recommend that you become a part of the team. Our preference, of course, is that everyone go through training in order to understand the guidelines for response: policies, procedures, safety, etc.

Donations

Virtually 100% of Rapid Disaster Relief (R.D.R.) is funded by donations. If you would like to support this relief effort we will keep all contributors up to date via social media (i.e. photos, daily posts, detailed operation successes, etc.) Disasters don’t all come in large packages like hurricanes or tornadoes.  Oftentimes a disaster can be mudslides or fires and with the support of donations, R.D.R will be there to help.

2014 Rapid Disaster Relief (R.D.R.) Donation Perks

Although we would like to offer big perks for your donations, R.D.R. feels that the money from the donations should be used for the relief effort. We are offering to our donors a very deep and heartfelt thank you as well as the following:

1.  Sponsor a cot.

For your donation of $500.00 you will sponsor a cot for a disaster victim. There are only a set number for the initial setup so they are first come first serve until we have more than one shelter running.

2.  Name on the trailer.

For your donation of $200.00 your name or business will be applied on the side of the truck on a 5”x 10” vinyl sticker so your name will be seen by all the victims your donation is helping. Space is limited so this is first come first serve until we get our second structure running.


 Where are the donation dollars going?

Your donation is greatly appreciated and it be will utilized to purchase the structure, self-contained portable solar system,  2 10kw wind turbines, 20kw diesel generator, laptops, Semi-Truck and Trailer, R.V. that sleeps six, insurance and other necessary expenditures to make this run smooth to help the disaster victims to the best of our ability.


These are Rapid Deployment Solar Panels that we will be using


This is the type of Wind Turbine that we will be using

This is the style of Air Supported Structure that will house the disaster victims



The R.D.R. Team Leaders

Joe Araiza is the lead and partner of Rapid Disaster Relief. He has worked for multiple Fortune 500 companies in Sales Management and Marketing and brings a strong sense of business management and operation to R.D.R. His drive and passion to help in disaster relief efforts are the catalyst behind the formation of this setup. After working with engineers and multiple companies for over 5 years, Joe feels R.D.R. is ready to launch and start moving from disaster location to disaster location with the ultimate goal of having a fleet to respond to multiple disasters simultaneously.

Stephen Ellis is a partner of Rapid Disaster Relief. A graduate of Wabash College, he brings strong operational and economic knowledge to R.D.R. After working with Joe on the solidification of the relief shelter, Stephen is ready to jump into action and begin the relief efforts.
story_txt:
Just a short Video and a few pics from a recent storm chaseA word from Joe and the RDR TeamI appreciate all of the help you many others have provided thus far. I have been pounding the pavement for months now but the area I live in and surrounding communities are slow to react to this. Disasters of the level Rapid Disaster Relief wants to deploy for rarely happen here and most of the people I talk to I have to educate on what the Red Cross and FEMA do and where Rapid Disaster Relief fits in. Most of the responses I get are "we have the Red Cross and my tax dollars go for FEMA". When we get those responses I sit with them and show them the void that Rapid Disaster Relief will fill. By the consistent effort of the team,we are getting close to our goal and I hope to find more funding to get multiple setups going. I really don't think there is a "right way" to explain the Red Cross and FEMA's issuses without sounding like we are diminishing or "bashing" them, because we are in NO WAY doing that.This may sound a little odd but when all of the storms hit during the last two weeks , I was getting frustrated while watching the news reports. The Red Cross did a great job responding but still wasn't enough. They are doing way too many tasks at a disaster to be fully efficient. In the North Carolina disaster it took them longer to get shelter up because they were trying to get the food, water, clothing and medical services going. The storms in MS, AR and OK last week  were the same result. I don't want to include this when I am presenting Rapid Disaster Relief because I never want it to sound like we are diminishing the Red Cross because they do an amazing job. What Rapid Disaster Relief is doing is helping them and other relief efforts be better equipped and more successful at each disaster site. We're not trying to reinvent the wheel, Rapid Disaster Relief is just trying to perfect it.

relieve human suffering caused by natural disasters by providing a 12,000 sq.
ft. air supported structure that will be operated via solar and wind turbine

power. The structure will house 500 cots for disaster victims as well as a Red
Cross station inside for their first responders. R.D.R. will also provide
satellite television for local and national news and satellite internet for the
disaster victims to stay in communication with family members via a bank of
laptops located  inside the structure. We

story:
Short Summary

Our son Jayden was diagnosed with Leukemia in May 2013 at the age of 4.  He will undergo over 3 years of treatment.  The first 8 months of treatment (frontline) was very intense.  He had weekly chemotherapy, spent much of the time in the hospital, had blood and platelet transfusions and had a very compromised immune system.  The next 2 1/2 years will entail daily chemo pills, monthly chemo infusions and more time possibly in the hospital.  Our lives were completely changed by this diagnosis.  Jayden could no longer attend school because of his immune system being so low and the intense treatment he received.  I (his mother) had to stop working so I could take care of him and his daily needs.  Our financial situation was completely turned around, so we had to move in with my mother.  We have 2 other children who were kind of put on the back burner and now have emotional problems of their own.  This diagnosis effects the entire family.  One of the things that kept us going was the support of organizations that help families in crisis.  Our family received blankets, pillow cases, stuffed animals, toys for in the hospital, gift cards for food and gas, sibling packages, etc.  These little things were Big things in our situation.  We want to start our own non-profit organization to give back to others going through this nightmare.  We want to create care packages for families in the hospital (gift cards, food for parents who are stuck in the hospital, comfort items, etc.), we want to throw events to raise awareness for Childhood Cancer (superhero runs, children's events, gala's) and we want to allow children special days of fun to forget about all they are going through (to the zoo, the movies, a theme park, etc.).  It's the small things that matter to these kids, and we want to do whatever we can to bring a smile to their little innocent faces. 

What We Need & What You Get

Starting a non-profit is not cheap.  It costs money to pay legal fees, preparation fees and filing fees.  it will cost about $1500 just to get the organization up and running.  After paying those costs we will begin events to raise awareness and money to create the care packages.  We will have annual events to raise the funds we need to put into the hospital care packages.  This is just the beginning of our Journey.  We are hoping after we are established and get going we can do bigger things.  Our son Jayden wants to help kids going through what he has been going through.  As he said the other day "Stand up and Get up and Stay Brave and Whatever you are going through Just do it and Get through it!"

The Impact

Childhood cancer is not rare like many people think.  In fact 1 in 330 children will get diagnosed with some form of cancer by the time they are 20 years old.  Less than 5% of federal government funding for cancer goes into childhood cancer.  It is the leading cause of death by disease for children.  We need to put a stop to this, we need to get better funding for our children so we can find better and less harsh treatments.  2/3 of children with cancer will have long lasting chronic conditions after treatment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Share our campaign to help get the word out.
  • Help raise awareness of Childhood Cancer.

story:
How It Began:

       While acting as a Summer Orientation Undergraduate Leader (SOUL) for Miami University of Oxford, Ohio, I stumbled upon a small and fairly unpublicized organization known as "Beards for Boobs" on our university's club website.  Although the prospect of defaulting into a student organization due to my ability to grow a beard was what initially piqued my interest, upon reading further into the organization's mission, I discovered the cause of its whimsical name.  

       The organization exists so that during the month of November, men who are a part of the group can grow out their facial hair in honor of No Shave November and ask for donations in return.  Subsequent to doing so , all funds accrued get donated to the Susan G. Komen Foundation, a non-profit that raises money to fund breast cancer research projects in an attempt to find a cure. It was such a simple, easy, and efficient way to earn money in the name of charity.  There was only one problem--no one I knew had heard of it.  

       I approached the members of Lambda Chi Alpha (the fraternity I am in) with the prospect of participating in Beards for Boobs as a group so that we could raise a fairly large amount of money to donate.   The idea was received well, and as a result the vast majority of ΛΧΑ members will be participating in No Shave November and asking for donations for the Susan G. Komen Foundation.  

       After having a number of meetings and organizing events so that everyone was aware of the Beards for Boobs donation schedule, I felt that we had all become a part of a very solid and efficient way to help out.  After all, money can be donated to the organization by a simple click of a button on their website.  My roommate (Adam Darby) and I decided that we needed to take this charity effort a step further, though.  We've turned the donation process into an inter-fraternal competition, in which every ΛΧΑ member participating in No Shave November will be competing against one another to see who can raise the most money.  There is no prize for winning--simply the satisfaction of knowing that we were able to start something that showed results.  

       Beginning November 1st, Adam and I will upload a picture of ourselves to an Imgur and Tumblr account in order to track the progress of our Novembeards.  The links to these pages can be found on my main Indiegogo page or by visiting http://themightynovembeard.tumblr.com/ and  http://imgur.com/user/themightynovembeard

       By helping us achieve our goal of $1000, you will have helped us contribute a very large amount of money to the pool of donations being given to the Susan G. Komen foundation through Beards for Boobs.  Every penny of this will go toward cancer research in hopes of finding a cure, and every penny counts.  

Thank you so much for your help and your contributions.  Without your help, we would not have the means to donate nearly as much as we hope to.  All the best, and keep the fight against cancer alive.  


David Malone

Miami University

maloned2@miamioh.edu

Adam Darby 

Miami University

darbyas@miamioh.edu

What We Need & What You Get

       In a breakdown, it's really quite simple.  Our goal is to raise at LEAST $1,000 to donate to Beards for Boobs and the Susan G. Komen Foundation (description above), and we need your help in order to do that.  

       The first three contributors to donate $100 or more will be sent a commemorative plaque to thank them for their generous donations.  The plaques will include their name, date, sum donated, the organization names, and will act as an official "thank you" from the brothers of Lambda Chi Alpha for helping us with our donation efforts.  

       Fear not---money used to purchase the plaques will be allocated directly from personal or fraternity funds; none of the money donated will be used for any purpose other than non-profit donation.  

       In the event that we are not able to reach our entire goal, what happens with the money will change.  All money raised will still go to Beards for Boobs and the Susan G. Komen Foundation.  However, in the event that we fall grossly short of our goal, no commemorative plaques will be distributed to the top three contributors.  

The Impact

       Every penny of your donation will fund cancer research and a search for a cure.  From research grants to necessary equipment, the effort to help discover a cure for cancer is in need of people like you and me to pitch in and help.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate at this time? No sweat.  Donating isn't the only way you can help fight against breast cancer:

  • Learn the signs and symptoms.  One of the easiest ways to prevent breast cancer from having a hugely negative impact on someone's life is early recognition.  The sooner it's caught, the easier it is to prevent harm.  Learn about risk factors and prevention by visiting http://ww5.komen.org/BreastCancer/LowerYourRisk.html
  • Participate in an event.  Events to spread awareness of breast cancer can be found by visiting http://ww5.komen.org/FindAnEvent.aspx
  • Take a stand. Sign up to become a Komen Advocate by visiting http://www.komenadvocacy.org/ (details on the page)
  • Start your own fundraiser.  Become a Passionately Pink Event Coordinator by visiting http://ww5.komen.org/GetInvolved/PassionatelyPink.html
  • Get involved.  Career and internship opportunities can be found by visiting http://ww5.komen.org/GetInvolved/Careers.html

What We Need & What You Get

       The first three contributors to donate $100 or more will be sent a commemorative plaque to thank them for their generous donations.  The plaques will include their name, date, sum donated, the organization names, and will act as an official "thank you" from the brothers of Lambda Chi Alpha for helping us with our donation efforts.  
       Fear not---money used to purchase the plaques will be allocated directly from personal or fraternity funds; none of the money donated will be used for any purpose other than non-profit donation.  
       In the event that we are not able to reach our entire goal, what happens with the money will change.  All money raised will still go to Beards for Boobs and the Susan G. Komen Foundation.  However, in the event that we fall grossly short of our goal, no commemorative plaques will be distributed to the top three contributors.  


The Impact
       Every penny of your donation will fund cancer research and a search for a cure.  From research grants to necessary equipment, the effort to help discover a cure for cancer is in need of people like you and me to pitch in and help.  


Other Ways You Can Help
Can't donate at this time? No sweat.  Donating isn't the only way you can help fight against breast cancer:



Learn the signs and symptoms.  One of the easiest ways to prevent breast cancer from having a hugely negative impact on someone's life is early recognition.  The sooner it's caught, the easier it is to prevent harm.  Learn about risk factors and prevention by visiting http://ww5.komen.org/BreastCancer/LowerYourRisk.html


Participate in an event.  Events to spread awareness of breast cancer can be found by visiting http://ww5.komen.org/FindAnEvent.aspx


Take a stand. Sign up to become a Komen Advocate by visiting http://www.komenadvocacy.org/ (details on the page)

Start your own fundraiser.  Become a Passionately Pink Event Coordinator by visiting http://ww5.komen.org/GetInvolved/PassionatelyPink.html


Get involved.  Career and internship opportunities can be found by visiting http://ww5.komen.org/GetInvolved/Careers.html

story:
My name is De Lynda Moore and I love helping and caring for people. So this is my new mission to help the Sissel Family to raise money for Travis medical bill. This Christmas Season please Pray about giving to our Campaign. Travis has a very hard fight ahead of him beating Cancer and has no health insurance. No amount is to small and any amount is Greatly Appreciated and a Blessing.


Thank you so much and God Bless,

De Lynda Moore

story:
Unify To Thrive is a non-profit organization (501c3) that was founded by Scott J. Schipper. Scott's motivation for establishing this charity came after being diagnosed with stage 4 colon cancer in November of 2011. Scott advocated for the elimination of pain and suffering caused by cancer by supporting the four major principles of cancer research:

  • Patient Support
  • Education
  • Research
  • Advocacy

On December 28, 2013 Scott lost his battle with cancer. In his honor, let us keep his spirit alive and through his message, his vision - Unify to Thrive.

story:
On July 24th 2013  Erin gave birth to a baby boy, "Greyson" at 25 weeks. That means he was born fifteen weeks before his due date or three and a half months early. With this our life has been turned upside down, as a low income family we were just surviving and with the added costs, this life changing event could financially kill us. With this unexpected arival there are now new various and coslty scenarios to add to the normal bills and rent. Now there extra costs such as Gas to and from BC Womens / Childrens Hospital ( 60 kilometers/40 miles from our home ), time lost to travel and costs involved with emergency lodging in the future there extra medical costs such as ambulance costs of needed at home nurse service oxygen if needed, I have had to take a leave from work to be with my child, so that alone doesn't help. There are no govenment grants in place for people within the Metro Vancouver area.

It is our Prayer and hope that later we can use some of these funds to help low income individuals such as ourselves from the metro Vancouver area with costs for lodging and costs, perhaps by establishing a foundation to help others who find themselves in a similar situation to ours.

 For more info on our little man please check out Greyson's page

https://www.facebook.com/Greysonspage

Or read about us

http://www.langleyadvance.com/business/Premie+parents+reaching+help+other+families/8751008/story.html


Thanks

Jamie, Erin and Greyson

story:
DESCRIPTION:

KED PERSONAL GPS COMPACT TRACKER

 

The KED Tracker will make families and friends feel safer in everyday life. Always know where your loved one’s are with a simple flip of your finger.

 

Program the KED for ANY DISTANCE
 

A child playing in the yard, out shopping or on a picnic (you choose the distance) 10 feet or 40 feet you decide!

Instant notification! What peace of mind!

Dad taking a walk around the neighborhood and gets lost or goes too far, no worries!

You will be instantly notified!

If your child is supposed to be in class or out in the front yard playing and suddenly is moving 33 MPH or more, we know they are in a vehicle!

Your elderly parent can have all the freedom and respect they deserve, yet safe and secure!

 

 

HOW IT WORKS:

Program the KED proximity alert from any distance from your smartphone app

Using a computer, smart phone or your Tablet you can simply log into your account and be able to track your loved one from anywhere.

This unit is super compact and durable weighing less then an ounce, and smaller than a standard flash drive.

It utilizes Global GSM, GPS and A-GPS technology meaning this device will work anywhere there is GSM coverage. Roaming packages provide out of country performance.

The KED has a powerful rechargeable battery lasting up to 7 days. Units can be placed in a car and used to track your vehicle/loved one. Even in the event the car battery is dead or disabled the devices 7 day battery backup will assist you and or Law Enforcement to find your vehicle.. There is also a 30 day memory on your account of the exact time and locations of the device.

Simply plug it into a USB port and the unit is fully charged in about an hour.

 

FEATURES:

 

SMALL COMPACT

REAL TIME GPS TRACKING  (accurate within 100 feet of locator)



PROXIMITY ALERT ALARMS VIA TEXT MESSAGE:



 
OVER SPEED LIMIT ALERTS VIA TEXT MESSAGE:
 


POWER ALERT INDICATORS VIA TEXT MESSAGE:



WATERPROOF CASEING:

 
 
 
 

USEABLE ON COMPUTER, SMART PHONE OR TABLET.

 

   The KED has another one of a kind feature:

                    It's a data tracker!!!

     Walking, jogging, biking even driving or riding in a car or on public transportation, all activity!  Input some simple information at the end of your busy day and let the KED keep track and inform the daily calories you burned!     From a beginner walking a mile in 20 minutes and advancing by walking that same mile in 15 minutes to the most trained Athlete it will inform you of your exact activity and keep track of that activity, increasing or decreasing, at your fingertips!

    I have a son that will be starting cross country this year. We are having a great deal of fun mapping his progress from week to week as he trains! It is exciting to see him able to adjust and improve with the data right there in real time. A simple easy tool that will maximize his potential and give him that push to improve.

    It is a great fun tool for a child to keep track and increase their activities.  They can map out their own plan and increase their activities daily.Each day they can compare the calories burned with the number of calories eaten. Let the KED show them that activity is fun and rewarding!

    As you were able to see in the description maybe not very rewarding for that new Teen driver exceeding the speed limit!

    

  This product is for everyone! Serving real purpose in our busy lives!

 

 
Who we are:-)
 
   My name is Sean C. McGittigan Sr.
 
   My family and I have recently experienced fear and heartbreak among friends and in our own family. This has led us to create the KED and it has been a project that started in our hearts. We have a burning desire to help and protect the most vulnerable among us.
 
   We know how much peace of mind and safety the KED will provide to caregivers of all those with special needs or anyone you feel a need to provide with extra precaution and safety! 
This is also a great tool for the parent of a new  teen driver, to know where they are or maybe at what speed they are driving! We believe the KED is the ultimate in non invasive personal safety!
 
 
    We are working with top notch advisors, technicians, and analyst to make the KED more compact with a longer lasting battery so it will fit with any accessory we have planned!
 
  With your interest and help we can make this a reality!
 

 

 
 
ACCESSORIES:
Special designed zip
pouches with iron
on adhesive can be
placed in almost any
article of clothing
 
A car kit will be available
to conceal in the car that
will work even if the battery
is dead or disabled.
 
 
Also special designed:
 
Hair Bows
Character belt loop holders
Key chains
Necklace
Bracelet
Special zipper pouches that can be placed on clothing with the simple swipe of an iron
And many more to come!!
 
Attractive accessories and designs for all ages.

story:
On September 15th at 8am, I climbed onto the 'You Are Beautiful' building, laid my yoga mat down on the roof, and I am not getting off this mat 'til all the funds for our campaign are raised. Period!

Watch live here.


When I was 15 years old, I nearly died from a stroke caused by severe anorexia. I was 58 pounds, severely depressed, and had given up on my life. Two weeks before my 16th birthday, I was removed from my parents’ custody and placed under the custodianship of the hospital. I lived there for nearly 18 months. 

When I got out of the hospital, my therapist encouraged me to try yoga. I was still significantly underweight and terrified of people, but I went... only to discover a practice (and community) that changed my life. I went from surviving to thriving; from living half a life to experiencing joy and freedom I never imagined possible. Over the past six years, I’ve developed a program called Yoga for Eating Disorders™ based on my experience. I offer it in hopes that others, too, can recover their lives from this disease.

Chances are you know someone with an eating disorder. Maybe it’s a daughter, maybe it’s a friend, maybe it’s an ex-lover or spouse. An estimated 24 million Americans suffer from eating disorders, but only 1 in 10 ever receive treatment. This disease kills nearly half a million people every year - it has the highest mortality rate of any mental illness. 

I used to believe that no one recovered from an eating disorder. Every person I knew who had struggled with this disease was still struggling, recovery seemed hopeless and impossible. But now I know: Freedom is possible. Joy is possible. There is a way out of this illness, and yoga is an incredible tool in paving the path to healing. 

My goal is to help other women find their way out of this illness -- just like my community helped me in my time of need. I am partnering with the Give Back Yoga Foundation to offer Yoga for Eating Disorders™ as a service at treatment centers and to conduct an evidence-based study on its effectiveness in improving treatment outcomes.  Please support our campaign. 

 

Yoga for Eating Disorders™ is a 3-day program that teaches patients practical tools to cope with difficult emotions, tune into hunger and fullness signals, and ultimately use yoga to support their recovery rather than act out in their eating disorder.

 

 

 

For every $5000 raised, we can offer the program at one treatment center in the United States.

Your funds support travel, lodging, data collection, curriculum development, support staff, materials, and related expenses.

Your funds will also allow me to visit one high school and one college in the hosting city to speak to young people about eating disorder prevention.

The sky is the limit. 50K is minimum. The more money we raise, the greater our potential impact. 

 

 

 

Healthcare

The average cost of treating an eating disorder is  $1,250 per day, and even at that rate over half of patients relapse after discharge. Yoga for Eating Disorders™ is a cost-effective program that teaches patients critical skills for long term recovery; potentially shortening treatment, reducing relapse, and ultimately saving lives.

Knowledge

Your support will allow us to collect data to assess whether Yoga for Eating Disorders™ improves treatment outcomes. Our hope is that this research will bestow greater legitimacy to yoga-based interventions in medical settings and ultimately make it possible to offer the program in centers worldwide.

Prevention

More than one half of teenagers use unhealthy control behaviors (e.g. fasting, vomiting and taking laxatives) to control their weight. Your support will allow me to speak with young people about developing healthy relationships with their bodies and emotions, as well as teach educators how to stop eating disorders before they start.

story:
Hi, my name is Lena (Jafar). I'm a PhD student. I'm a transexual. After suffering a long time with gender identity problem, I find the right answer: I want to be a lady and be attracted to ladies. I want to be a fem! Living in a conservative family didn't allow me to even think about my real identity. Now that I have more independence from my family, and have more freedom from internalized transphobia, I feel relief by saying: I want to be a lady and live with another lady! 

Since last October, I've started the work of transitioning from male to female. I need to raise funds for my surgery treatments. I am continuing my psychotherapy and facial hair removal. I am taking a sperm storage and starting hormones. I need to pay for my doctors visits, sperm storage, medications, hormones, lab tests, etc. Unfortunately, those treatments are not covered by insurance.

My surgery treatments take about twenty month. It takes eight months to develop the breasts and remove the facial hair.  It also takes such amount of time to have the body fat and hair changed to a more feminine appearance. Then, I have to live as a woman full time for a year to get permission for sex reassignment surgery.

I must pay $750.00 for facial hair removal.  

I must pay $2000.00 for three years of sperm storage to Pacific Reproductuve Services in Pasadena, California.

I must pay $200.00 a month for psychotherapy.

I must pay an average of $120.00 per sessions to my endocrinologist every month. I also have to pay $100.00 a month for my hormones injections and/or patches. The lab tests for hormone level and liver levels will cost an average of $200.00 every three months.

I must pay more than $10,000 for my surgery.

The supplemental expnenses are for a wig, extra psychiatric treatments, etc.

Your donations will not only help me but also the growth of the transexual community through more recognition and support.

Just in case I don't reach my pre-surgery goal of transitioning to a lady, I'll give your donations to Queer Resource Center of Claremont Colleges. I'm currently pursuing a PhD at Claremont Graduate University.

Please pass my request to anyone you know who might be willling to help in my transition. You can do so through the indiegogo sharing tools.

story:
The money that we raise through this effort will be used lay the ground work for the organization. We will also start granting funds to the Waaw School in Cusco to provide dental care to kids and begin developing a long-term educational program for the kids and their mothers. 

MISSION:

Our mission is to provide dental care, teach oral hygiene to, and develop simple educational materials (English and Spanish) for underprivileged children in South America and encouraging volunteerism to accomplish these goals.

THE ISSUE:

New information on the importance of good oral health is coming to light every day. One of the most important health issues affecting children in South America is their dental hygiene. Millions of latino children are not capable of handling their own oral care due to such factors as poverty, geography, lack of oral health education, language or cultural barriers, or the fear of dental care.

With every new year and each new study, scientists discover more and more links between good oral hygiene and overall, systemic health. Preventative education and early treatment can prevent or halt the process of most oral diseases. 

THESOLUTION:

Existing nonprofit organizations and government agencies are not addressing the issue from a youth perspective as aggressively as is needed. Todas Sonrisas will use existing channels and funding sources as well as new and innovative grassroots fundraising to build the foundation of this organization. The organization will leverage the priorities, enthusiasm, and leadership of the organization and potential volunteers to create simple educational programs and materials that will be easily reproduced and distributed.   

MORE INFORMATION:

If you want more information before you donate, please find us on Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/todas.sonrisas) or email Executive Director, Patrick Nelson (patrick.r.nelson@gmail.com) for an informational brochure (in PDF format) or our Concept Paper.

story:
The Wagon Of Doom 2

Whether you've driven it or not, you have heard of the mythical beast, affectionately referred to as the WOD.   This particular car is the 2nd evolution.  The first car met it's maker a couple years ago.  This one has one foot in the grave...

Current Issues:

  • Broken axle, passenger front
  • Stuck brake caliper, driver's front
  • Exhaust is missing
  • Do the wipers even work?
  • Rear bumper is gone
  • Front bumper is held on with zip ties
  • The handbrake is questionable
  • The last oil change was....what year is it?
  • The wheels and tires are coming off to go on my FXT

Over the past 6 years or so, I've let numerous people destroy my rallyx beaters (the WOD, WOD2, Douche Rocket, Forester, RS), and I've never asked for a dime in return.

I'm still not actually asking for money.  I'm just telling people that I'm not willing to spend any more money to keep these things running, especially when I have a rally car to finish.

So, if I don't want to fix it...

...why did I do this?

Well, even though I really shouldn't, I feel bad not having something for people to drive without destroying their own cars.  So, that being said, here is your chance!  If you really want this thing fixed instead of scrapped, help raise enough money to make it worth my while to roll around in the mud, snow, ice, and whatever else is in the field (probably some misery and despair...)

The Impact

So if you want to see the tradition stay alive, donate.  If you thought it was cool when it was free, but don't feel like helping out, that's cool too (I know how you feel, trust me).  I'll scrap it and get a few bucks that way too. It has a clean title!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Buy the car from me and do with it as you wish
  • Magically fix it
  • Finish building my rally car
  • Burn it to the ground (the WOD2, not the rally car)

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
The Wagon Of Doom 2
Whether you've driven it or not, you have heard of the mythical beast, affectionately referred to as the WOD.   This particular car is the 2nd evolution.  The first car met it's maker a couple years ago.  This one has one foot in the grave...Current Issues:
Broken axle, passenger front

Stuck brake caliper, driver's front

Exhaust is missing
Do the wipers even work?
Rear bumper is gone
Front bumper is held on with zip ties
The handbrake is questionable
The last oil change was....what year is it?

story:
Seven-year-old, Safia, in critical condition needs financial help for the medical care she is undergoing at the Rainbow Children's Hospital. She has been having continuous seizures and the CT scan showed swelling in her brain. She has been diagnosed with meningitis and pneumonia. She is right now in the intensive care unit and has to be monitored continuously. She had to be actively put into a forced coma to stop the seizures as it can do further damage to her brain. 

Safia was in another hospital which did not have proper equipments and facilities to treat her. Once she started to get continuous fits, the mother, Ayesha, started to panic as she could see that the child needed better care. By this time we had already published our first campaign to raise $ 500. Moving Safiya for better hospital for expert care meant more expenses. We have plunged into it with both feet as we needed to rescue a beautiful life. We are hoping that everyone that reads this would donate generously. 

Safiya's mother, Ayesha, is a single mother of three children and Safiya is the youngest studying in 2nd grade. It is a family struggling to educate the three children, Hajira, Mubarak and Safiya. When I went to visit the child in the hospital I could see that Ayesha is totally devastated to see her daughter in this condition. 

We also want to thank everyone that responded to our first campaign a few days ago. Those funds will be added to this new campaign. 

Please click on the link below and fill up the details to receive a donation receipt from "Family Development Services"  - Safiya's Medical Fund - Registration Form: https://form.jotform.com/52890775853975

For Indian donors that need TAX EXEMPTION may directly transfer funds to the following account by making a note saying "Designated to Safiya's medical fund".

South Indian Bank
Branch : Christ University , Bangalore, India.
Name of the Charity: Family Development Services
Savings Account No.: 0396053000041845
IFSC code: SIBL0000396

We will be posting regular updates for all to see. Please keep her in your prayers!!

story:
Adderall (n): A prescription drug, an amphetamine with a popular black market on college campuses across America.  A drug with addictive properties and unintended side effects that was never designed for everyday use by healthy adults.
Nootropic (n): A broad classification of drugs or compounds with cognitive enhancing properties with minimal side-effects appropriate for long-term use — the scientific nomenclature for "smart drugs."

Introducing SPRINT: The People's Nootropic

"Cognitive enhancement has much to offer individuals and society, and a proper societal response will involve making enhancements available while managing their risks."

- Greely [Stanford Law School] et. al. 2008

SPRINT is a new revolution in nootropics.

Nootropics are "smart drugs" - supplements that people eat to sharpen their creativity, concentration, or other mental functions. 

SPRINT is designed as a safe, cheap, and legal alternative to recreational use of Adderall. It is designed to help anyone with energy, clarity, and flow - so it's perfect for exams, long days at work, or other stressful attention-demanding activities.


Help us bring Sprint to market and bring you the safest and most effective way to enhance your focus.

What's It Feel Like?

SPRINT is designed for people who need to perform at maximum level on challenging mental tasks - whether studying for an exam, jamming through a long week at work, or waiting tables during the hectic evening rush.

What helps us in these moments of high intensity, when we want to be able to reliably perform at 100%?

The obvious answer is energy. But we all know that feeling of having too many coffees and being too wired to actually focus. At a certain point, coffee, energy drinks can be counter-productive. 

It turns out relaxation is the key to peak mental output. SPRINT is designed to promote alertness, while also providing a relaxing feel, reducing stress and anxiety. 

Imagine a fighter pilot or surgeon behaving calmly under stress - alert and judicious, yet not a single jitter. 

That mindstate is often described as "being in flow," and that's what SPRINT delivers.
We're well aware that some people like to use prescription medicines like Adderall, maybe buying pills from their friends, but that can be like using a sledgehammer to crack a nut. So we've developed an effective, safe, and responsible alternative.  
Read on!

A Brief History of Smart Drugs

One of the oldest known cognitive enhancers, caffeine, was used by Ethiopians a millennium ago - they would grind it up with lard for a quick snack to promote alertness. [1]

Fast forward a thousand years to the present. To say caffeine is available on every corner would be an understatement. THC (marijuana) is known to relieve psychological stress and enhance a creative mindset. LSD and psilocybin (found in mushrooms) have been used to treat psychological disorders and unlock transcendental thought patterns.[2] Prescription drugs like Adderall have been developed to help people with cognitive impairments, and healthy adults also take these to help with cognition.

Widespread use of smart drugs aka "nootropics" is the next paradigm in human advancement, a cousin to discoveries like the electric light-bulb, airplanes, modern medicine, the Internet, and other means of advancing our own ingenuity as a human species.

We are on the cusp of smart drugs being completely commonplace, if only there was an option that was safe, accessible, and widely accepted. 

 "If an alien were looking at humanity and asking "What is human nature?" one of the ingredients [would be] that these beings seem quite concerned with improving their capacities and they seem to have a knack for doing it."  [3]

The Present: The War on Adderall

Adderall is a rough "proof of concept" of a nootropic, but it misses the mark. Adderall, an amphetamine initially designed to treat people diagnosed with ADHD or narcolepsy, is in a heydey of popularity. It's used on a widespread basis on college campuses and in workplaces across the nation, despite the fact that it's a prescription drug, and buying/selling it casually is a crime in the US, punishable by prison. [4]

The premise of Adderall is exciting: pop a pill and plug in. However, two major issues set it back from becoming truly mainstream:
  • Physically risky - The ingredients in Adderall are overkill for many people who use it off-prescription: it's too powerful, too addicting, and has too many negative withdrawal issues. 
  • Unlevel playing field - Adderall is out of reach to many, which puts many at an unfair disadvantage. It's prescription, it's expensive, and it's traded illegally (largely among affluent people with little to fear from the law).

Adderall has not been developed specifically for the kind of cognitive enhancement it is often used for: everyday use by healthy adults.

We can do better than Adderall. With your help, we are leading the next step forward for cognitive supplements. Something that's legal, affordable, and safe. Something that's a supplement, not a prescription drug. Something that can benefit everyone.

Why is the most popular nootropic in America an expensive prescription drug that's widely bought and sold on the black market? Can there be something safe, effective, and as accessible as a pack of gum?

SPRINT: Leveling the Playing Field

Access to cognitive supplements should be freely available, like toothpaste or Tylenol, not just limited to those who are willing to take risks, spend big bucks, or buy on the black market.

In designing SPRINT, over 3/4ths of people we talked to said they'd be interested in using nootropics if the right option was made available.

The stage is set for the paradigm shift to take place, but we need a safer, milder, more widely-avaiable product - something that will make its way into classrooms and workplaces and 7-11's and gas stations across the globe! 

A movement gets built one person at a time - so if you've been looking for something like this, please keep reading, share with a friend, and join us in helping make this a reality!

We started from scratch 6+ months ago and have put a ton of thought into developing the right product: something that you feel comfortable using, something that helps you hit your full mental potential, something that's convenient, attractive and affordable.

Ingredients.

So what's in SPRINT? 

One of our main ingredients is L-theanine, which has some interesting effects when coupled with caffeine, which is also an ingredient of SPRINT. Found in small amounts in tea, L-Theanine is known to "promote a state of relaxation without causing drowsiness." [4]

What if you could be relaxed yet alert? 

When you think of your ideal productive mindstate when studying or working, it probably looks nothing like a Red Bull commercial. Stuff like Red Bull and 5 Hour Energy and Starbucks gets you amped, but we all know that too much energy can be stressful and therefore counter-productive.

Being in the zone means feeling cool and in control. 


 "In particular, L-theanine and caffeine in combination appear to improve, significantly, aspects of memory and attention to a greater extent than caffeine alone... The combination [of Caffeine & L-theanine] was associated with an improved ability to focus attention, whilst caffeine alone lead to an improvement in basic response speed or accuracy but not both."[5]

Beyond L-theanine & caffeine, SPRINT has a short list of ingredients, all FDA-approved and targeted to improve energy, clarity, and flow. We think it's important to be fully transparent, so we have no "proprietary blends" and you can see our formula below:

  • Caffeine (100mg) - Same amount as in a 6 oz cup of coffee.
  • L-theanine (200mg) - Pairs well with caffeine to enhance core cognitive abilities, see above. [4]
  • Inositol (185mg) - An anxiolytic (anxiety inhibitor). [6][7]
  • Vitamins B6 (20 mg) and B12 (1mg) - Increases cell metabolism & aid in production of vital neurotransmitters. Provides an energy boost. [8][9]
  • Glucuronolactone (185 mg)- Causes increase in levels of naturally-occurring glucuronides, which bind with toxic substances and remove them from the body. [10]
We definitely encourage you to read the studies linked above. All of our ingredients are FDA-approved for over-the-counter supplementation. The FDA is conservative in what it labels as safe for human consumption, because their job is to protect the public health by assuring the safety, efficacy and security of ingestible goods sold to the public. 

Packaging

Form follows function, as they say. 

The packaging should not be an afterthought. 

We iterated through dozens hundreds of packaging designs, and ran them by friends & strangers for opinions.

Here's what we found out: 

Convenience is king. People want something that slides into your pocket. People want something clean, modern, and small. Something that fits in next to their wallet, keys, and cell phone and other necessary daily items. Something that feels good, something that you can identify with.

Good design should omit everything superfluous, leaving only the essential.

We have two options. Option 1 is an small, stocky, clear glass bottle, made of nice thick glass that feels perfect in your hands, and contains exactly 10 capsules of SPRINT. 
Option 2 is a team supply, which contains 20 packs in a nifty dispenser - perfect for the office or kitchen. It's a "gravity dispenser," meaning that when you take out a pack, the next one slides into place. Each pack is similar to Dentyne Ice or other gums where you pull off the sleeve and pop out a SPRINT. It's about 2" x 3" and easily fits in your pocket.
Check out the perks for all the ways to get this!

Too Good To Be True?

Hasn't this been done before? 

No, not really. That's why we're here, doing this. Nobody else has actually put the pieces together, making something safe & effective with well-designed packaging, messaging, and branding. Ask yourself this: Why isn't there a name brand smart drug available in 7-11 next to the chewing gum? That's the question that got us started.

How we spend our time, our limited number of hours in the day, matters now more than ever. It's an exciting time to be alive. Movies like Limitless and Lucy are total fictionalizations, but they touch a nerve because the promise of a better mind is truly exciting, and something we have been seeking for millennia.

This paradigm shift isn't going to happen on its own. We need your help to make it happen!

As a special gift to you, we're making a limited edition shirt that's only available for people who support our Indiegogo campaign. This shirt won't be available after the campaign! Get em while they're hot - they're guaranteed to be a collector's item.


Our Goal

If we succeed in making nootropics commonplace, it will be the next chapter in humankind's ongoing stride towards self-improvement.

We have the vision, we have the plan, we have the momentum. All we need is you!

The journey of a thousand miles starts with a single step, and our first step is a production run where we need a minimum run of $10k. We work with an FDA-approved manufacturing partner (who we've worked with previously. They produce vitamin supplements for a variety of premium brands. In order to have our product made in their state-of-the-art facility, we need to meet their minimum order quantity of $10k. There is no maximum to how much we can supply.

100% of any profit we see on this campaign will go into the next production run, and then the next. We're on a mission, and you can say you helped kick off the movement!

Our main perks are the product themselves, as well as really cool posters and a limited number of super high quality shirts (have we mentioned we're obsessed with details & design?)

Why Us?

Geoff and I have been friends since going to college at Stanford, where we both studied Computer Science. We've scored 99th %ile on the big 4 tests: ACT, SAT, GRE, and GMAT. We know how to work and excel in some of the most challenging, demanding, and exciting academic environments in the world. 

By senior year in college, I was teaching public speaking and computer science classes to other undergraduates; Geoff was doing advanced research into distributed systems, which he eventually turned into a company that he and his team successfully sold in 2013. While Geoff was working on his first startup, I was working at Google as a product manager. After Geoff sold his company, he became an Entrepreneur in Residence at one of Silicon Valley's top venture capital firms, where I then joined him and we began working together. We became fascinated by nootropics, and got to work on building a nootropics company like no one has ever seen.

Our company is called Nootrobox, and SPRINT is our second product line. Our first product, RISE, is meant as a daily cognitive supplement that's beneficial when you take it habitually, whereas SPRINT is for an immediate boost when it's time to get the job done.

Our Progress

SPRINT is made in a state-of-the-art cGMP audited FDA factory in the United States. We have worked with our production facility in the past, and they are extremely professional. We have a firm grip of the timeline, we know the ins-and-the-outs of the supply chain and production process.

With your help, we will seal the deal and this will be in your hands in the first half of 2015. Our steps to get there:

  1. Identify a state of the art, FDA compliant factory.
  2. Finalize packaging design (finalize artistic direction, UPC barcode, nutrition facts labeling)
  3. Purchase ingredients.
  4. Test raw materials for purity.
  5. Manufacture the pills.
  6. Test final pills for purity and correct dosages of each ingredient. Produce a CoA (Certificate of Analysis).
  7. Manufacture the packaging (concurrent with #3-6 above)
  8. Package
  9. Ship to you!

Shout It Out!

Do you have a friend who'd be curious about something like this? A classmate or colleague who uses Adderall? Someone who's preparing to take a big test like the SAT, GMAT, or MCAT?

Spread the word, and you can help make this a reality! Check us out on instagram and twitter for updates. 

Questions?

Don't be shy! We're all ears, super honest, and we think about this stuff all day long. We'd love to hear from you.

If you want further reading, definitely check out our blog post where we go more into the history and culture of cognitive supplements.

In order to have our product made in their state-of-the-art facility, we need to meet their minimum order quantity of $10k. There is no maximum to how much we can supply.
100% of any profit we see on this campaign will go into the next production run, and then the next. We're on a mission, and you can say you helped kick off the movement!
Our main perks are the product themselves, as well as really cool posters and a limited number of super high quality shirts (have we mentioned we're obsessed with details & design?)


Why Us?
Geoff and I have been friends since going to college at Stanford, where we both studied Computer Science. We've scored 99th %ile on the big 4 tests: ACT, SAT, GRE, and GMAT. We know how to work and excel in some of the most challenging, demanding, and exciting academic environments in the world. 
By senior year in college, I was teaching public speaking and computer science classes to other undergraduates; Geoff was doing advanced research into distributed systems, which he eventually turned into a company that he and his team successfully sold in 2013. While Geoff was working on his first startup, I was working at Google as a product manager. After Geoff sold his company, he became an Entrepreneur in Residence at one of Silicon Valley's top venture capital firms, where I then joined him and we began working together. We became fascinated by nootropics, and got to work on building a nootropics company like no one has ever seen.
Our company is called Nootrobox, and SPRINT is our second product line. Our first product, RISE, is meant as a daily cognitive supplement that's beneficial when you take it habitually, whereas SPRINT is for an immediate boost when it's time to get the job done.
Our Progress
SPRINT is made in a state-of-the-art cGMP audited FDA factory in the United States. We have worked with our production facility in the past, and they are extremely professional. We have a firm grip of the timeline, we know the ins-and-the-outs of the supply chain and production process.



With your help, we will seal the deal and this will be in your hands in the first half of 2015. Our steps to get there:

Identify a state of the art, FDA compliant factory.
Finalize packaging design (finalize artistic direction, UPC barcode, nutrition facts labeling)
Purchase ingredients.
Test raw materials for purity.
Manufacture the pills.
Test final pills for purity and correct dosages of each ingredient. Produce a CoA (Certificate of Analysis).
Manufacture the packaging (concurrent with #3-6 above)
Package
Ship to you!

Shout It Out!
Do you have a friend who'd be curious about something like this? A classmate or colleague who uses Adderall? Someone who's preparing to take a big test like the SAT, GMAT, or MCAT?
Spread the word, and you can help make this a reality! Check us out on instagram and twitter for updates. 
Questions?Don't be shy! We're all ears, super honest, and we think about this stuff all day long. We'd love to hear from you.

If you want further reading, definitely check out our blog post where we go more into the history and culture of cognitive supplements.

story:
Function Introduction


How it works

Monitoring principle

Our whole team members are devoted to Modoo, a big innovation that cares about your loved ones. You can learn more about how it works through this picture: 

  • Wooden trumpet- “sound receiver”: only professional doctors who have over thirty-year experience can distinguish the baby’s heartbeat from other sounds. 
  • Stethoscope: still, only professional doctors can distinguish baby’s heartbeat from other sounds.
  • Modoo: everyone can hear the ORIGINAL baby’s heartbeat through Modoo and the App.
Modoo is using a completely safe way to monitor babies. We call it “passive monitoring”, and the picture above shows the progress of our technology.

Monitoring& Data


【Monitor】

  • Dimensions: 40mm* 6mm
  • Material: stainless steel, ABS plastic 
  • Waterproof: IPX5 
  • Continuous working time: 7 days （Battery life varies by use and configuration）
  • Silicone case: medical-grade silicone 
  • Total weight: < 20g

【Wireless charger】

  • Dimensions: 28mm * 12mm
  • Material: ABS plastic

Nine months of hard work shows our resolution of representing this cute device to all the parents expecting their babies. Now, we have come forward to this new stage and we need your help to optimize our prototype and take it into production and mass production.



Challenge

About Safety

Safety is our priority because Modoo is a product for the moms and their babies. We have developed two latest technologies and applied for Chinese patent. 

Marketing Education

Users are not familiar with us because 24/7 wearable fetal monitoring device is a new product. We definitely will try our best to go into people’s sight through various channels, however, your sharing means a lot to us!  :)




FAQ

About product usage

Q1. How to turn Modoo on? 

A: Modoo doesn’t have a power button. It is switched on by default and senses the status of wearer automatically. When placed it on the mother’s stomach, Modoo starts monitoring work at the present frequency. Its working status and data output can be accessed on the App through Bluetooth connection whenever needed.

Q2. How can moms find the position of the babys’ heart?

A：Open the  App, activate “Heartbeat search”, and move Modoo slowly on your belly; the  App will alert you when the right position is detected; keep the patch in the position to start monitoring.

Q3. How to charge Modoo?

A: Modoo charges wirelessly. To start charging, simply place it on the wireless charging base.

Q4. Intermittent wear and continuous wear, which way is better for monitoring effectiveness?

We recommend continuous wear that can collect more complete data and information. So mothers-to-be can receive notifications at anytime and anywhere.

Q5. Do you recommend mothers-to-be wear Modoo when sleeping?

Yes, we do. Firstly, this way will ensure the completeness of monitoring. Secondly, Modoo will collect more precise information and data at quiet night. 

Q6. Will monitoring information and data be saved? How long will them be saved?

Yes. After Modoo sending monitoring information and data to server, personal health information and data will be connected with personal accounts and be saved. Users can log in their personal accounts to check the monitoring information and data.

Q7. May I log in the same account on different smart devices?

Yes. But you cannot log in the same account on different smart devices simultaneously. Our App is compatible on any smart devices with iOS 7 and above and Android 4.3 and above.

Q8. May I record the sound of my baby’s heartbeat?

Yes. Open the App and stay at “fetal heart monitoring” page, then Modoo can record and save the sound of baby’s heartbeat. Mothers-to-be can listen it at anytime and anywhere. 


About product safety

Q1. What is “passive monitoring”?

We do not send signal to mothers’ body. It’s more like that we are carefully listening baby’s heartbeat and collecting baby's heart rate and movement by ears.

Q2. Will Modoo radiate mothers’ body or babies?

No. Modoo is using passive monitoring technology, thus, there is no signal transmission.

Q3. Is modoo Water proof?

Yes, it is. Modoo is composed of medical-grade stainless steel. It not only is water proof, but also is preventing from sweat erosion.

Q4. Is the silicone paste a single-use product?

The silicone paste is the 3M medical-grade, which can be multiple-use. The specific use time depends on different users.


About Indiegogo campaign

Q1. Where do you ship?

We welcome friends from all over the world to support our Indiegogo campaign. But our instruction and App system language are only English and Chinese for now.

Q2. Do you offer warranty? How long the warranty is valid?

Yes, we do. We offer a one-year warranty for your Modoo.

Q3. How can I contact your team?

We value your opinions and feedbacks. If you have any questions, please fell free to contact us at: info@extantfuture.com

story:
SEE COLORADO'S OWN CHANNEL 2 NEWS VIDEO ON FIRESTOP: http://wp.me/p1ZRmT-1wGe

SEE DENVER POST ARTICLE ON FIRESTOP:http://www.denverpost.com/headlines/ci_21230203/northern-colorado-men-find-new-way-protect-homes

FireStop – Eco-Conscious Wildfire
Prevention and Beyond

Hello, my name is Tim Haag; environmentally conscious individual and
retired Fire Marshall after 34 years of service. A few years ago, I met a
brilliant inventor, Dennis Cortese, at a live burn demonstration in the state
of Colorado. Through this chance meeting, I discovered FireStop, a product
designed to protect homes from the ravages of wildfires. This is an
eco-friendly, reasonably priced system that can be self-installed or installed
with the help of a contractor. 


Featured in Two Major CO Media Outlets


Colorado’s Best TV Interview on KWGN


http://coloradosbest.tv/2012/09/21/new-product-could-save-homes-wildfires/

The Denver Post


Article, The Denver Post: Northern Colorado Men Find New Way to
Protect Homes from Fire: A new foam designed from Tim Haag and Dennis Cortese is an added protection. By Pamela Dickman: Reporter-Herald Staff Writerhttp://www.denverpost.com/headlines/ci_21230203/northern-colorado-men-find-new-way-protect-homes


How It Works

Imagine a story you have surely seen on your local evening news station
(multiple times over). A wildfire approaches and the owners are ordered to
evacuate. They gather their family, a few precious items and run. As the fire
starts to burn the structure, a fire sensor mounted on the roof of the home
detects the fire and activates the system. The roof and walls of the home begin to be covered automatically with FireStop foam. In seconds, this foam totally encapsulates the home in a thick white foam that will last up to 72 hours.
After the danger has passed and the home owners and their family are allowed
back, they find their home is safe. They wash off the remaining foam and the
clean up is done. That’s right — homes do not need to be destroyed from wildfires!
But, without this protection, once a wildfire starts attacking a home it is too
late.



FireStop is the world’s only fully automated fire prevention device to spray
fire retardant foam on homes and other valuable structures. The foam is
formulated to be COMPETELY SAFE FOR THE ENVIRONMENT. The formula is top secret and, unfortunately, can not be revealed. Imagine, also, the implications of water conservation for the planet.

Vast Potential


This foam is not limited to homes alone, the potential is vast. Uses can be
found for any instance of fire including: vehicles, ships, aircrafts, tanker
trucks, oil rigs etc…



After years of successful research, development and field-testing, FireStop
is ready to implement; we just need your help. All that is needed to save
thousands of lives and homes taken unnecessarily by the devastation of a
wildfire is funds to produce, market and distribute FireStop to big box retailers nationwide. Fires can be dealt with in a more eco-friendly, effective and efficient manner with a technology such as ours. 

Future of Firestop

FireStop will be established as a solely non-profit organization dedicated
to saving lives and the planet.

Supporting Evidence


Please read this article for predictions about the future impact of
wildfires on the West. Though published in 2012, it still is valid regarding
current affairs:



Science Daily Online, Article: Sobering Future of Wildfire Dangers in U.S.
West, Researchers Predict. Source: University of Oregon. Summary: The American West has seen a recent increase in large wildfires due to droughts, the build-up of combustible fuel, or biomass, in forests, a spread of fire-prone
species and increased tree mortality from insects and heat. A research team
warns that these conditions may be "a perfect storm" for more fires…

http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2012/02/120214134936.htm

Giving Back


With a donation of only $25, FireStop will donate 10% of the total proceeds
back to victims displaced by wildfires in Colorado in 2014. Help us help them,
and prevent others from going through what they have had to endure.


Money will be given personally to each family with a letter telling how
this donation came to be. A list of all those who helped us get this project
off the ground will be included on our website (currently being developed).



Main Image Courtesy of www.wikipedia.comThumbnail
Image Courtesy of http://multivu.prnewswire.com/mnr/adcouncil/50581/

Help Us Meet Our Goal of Becoming a Not-for Profit Organization

Thanks for Your Support!

story:
WiCub 2 Delivery - January 2020

Why is Indoor Air Quality (IAQ) important?

"The health impacts of poor outdoor air quality are well known – polluted air has been linked to respiratory tract infections, lung cancer and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). A two-year study by medical journal The Lancet found that 6.5 million people die prematurely every year as a result of poor air quality."

The hidden air pollution inside your workplace by Chris Stokel-Walker @ BBC

Indoor Air Quality is often 2 to 5 times worse¹ than it is outside. Plus, people generally spend more time indoors, especially the very young and the elderly, who are more susceptible to indoor air pollution.

The first step in improving your Indoor Air Quality is by measuring (monitoring) it. Having a reference of what your Indoor Air Quality (IAQ) is, and then making changes to improve it, allows you to see first hand if the changes applied are having any effect.

WiCub 2 is the cute little smart device for this.

 

Tons of features in a tiny package

  • WiFi Enabled
  • Emoji E-ink Display Technology
  • Daily Air Quality Report via Email
  • 5 minute Data Logging
  • 20+ day Data Storage
  • Alerts:
    • Email
    • On Display
  • German Engineered Digital Multi Sensor:
    • Indoor Air Quality (VOCs)
    • Pressure
    • Temperature
    • Humidity
  • Portable: 47 x 47 x 20 mm
  • Light Weight @ 38g
  • 40+ day battery life
  • Rechargeable (USB Micro)
  • Simple Guided Setup
  • Over the Air (OTA) Upgrades
  • Third Party Integration options

#investinyourhealth

Improve your wellbeing by improving your indoor air quality

The sensor within WiCub 2 can detect a broad range of gases to measure air quality for personal well being. Gases that can be detected include Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC) from paints (such as formaldehyde), lacquers, paint strippers, cleaning supplies, furnishings, office equipment, glues, adhesives and alcohol.

 

 

WiCub 2 at home...

I always thought the air in my home was clean; it seemed clean as there were no smells.

And then one day I brought WiCub 2 home and he was not a happy chappy...

I could not understand why, when the air seemed just fine; but obviously WiCub 2 was sensing much more than what my nose could.

Then I opened some windows...

Half an hour later WiCub 2 was much happier.

Even though there was no smell inside the home, there was a build of VOCs that I could not detect that was easily resolved simply by ventilating.

WiCub 2 is so easy to use that even my 7 year old tells me if WiCub 2 is not happy.

The beauty about WiCub 2 is that it is constantly monitoring my home and sends out a daily email report. Here's one for my bedroom:

Got a humidity alert when the pressure dropped and the rain come pouring down...

Using the data from WiCub 2, I can now make informed decisions that will improve not only mine but also my family's well being.

I hope you will invest in your health and live healthy.

 

WiCub 2 in a plane

WiCub 2 with it's 40+ day battery life and small size, makes it truly portable.

On a recent trip, WiCub 2 shows what the air quality is really like in an aeroplane.

Explains why we also feel like that after a long flight.

Third Party Integrations

If you'd like WiCub 2 to send data to your own server, then you can easily do this by specifying your own custom endpoint URL during setup.

Data is sent in JSON format that can easily be parsed by your web service.

Also available is an option to use a third party web platform called IoTpool (separate charges may apply)

 

Delivery - January 2020

We aim to deliver WiCub 2 in January 2020.

We have already completed an initial production run and whilst the campaign is running we will be finalising firmware, testing & packaging.

Every crowd funding project has a degree of risk to it. In our case this being our third crowd funding campaign, we do have the experience on delivering hardware - we've had our share of ups (WiCub) and downs (BluCub) with crowdfunding so have set realistic expectations.

One thing is for certain, this will be your only chance to get WiCub 2 at a massively discounted price.

 

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Thank you for your support and we'd be very grateful if you'd share our campaign on social media.

 

References:

¹ - EPA Indoor Air Quality - https://www.epa.gov/report-environment/indoor-a...
