Skin temperature for now. In the future, it may track others.
Why is the Quantlet funding itself through Indiegogo crowdfunding?
As many of you know, we have chosen the crowdfunding platform Indiegogo to raise the necessary funds to finalize our production-ready design of the Quantlet. Many of you have asked why we didn't go the more traditional routes like venture capital, selling the company, or finding other investors.
The short answer is this: We carefully considered all of our options. We chose Indiegogo over other options because crowdfunding is the best way to align the needs of our company and its innovative device with the interests of those of its end-users. 
For International backers, does my shipping fee cover duties/taxes?
Unfortunately, no. Like any other purchase from a retailer based in the US, we will ship as a commercial product with an invoice and any resulting duties are the responsibility of the backer. The fees collected via Indiegogo only cover the shipping fees per se.
What is the product warranty provided?
The Quantlet has a limited 90-day warranty that exclusively covers manufacturing defects. The device must be used in accordance to manufacturer instructions as included in the User Manual found here https://thequantlet.com/setup
The product warranty does NOT cover damage by the user such as broken bands, early battery failures from usage multiple times per day, and other similar circumstances.
The product warranty is not transferable if the device is resold or its ownership transfered to someone other than the individual placing the original order.
 
“Do You Still Have Questions About The Quantlet?We Have The Answers!” 
 
Please contact our Support team via email through info @ quantlets.com with any questions.
 

Risks & Challenges
We’re excited to launch the Quantlet and can’t wait to deliver it to you! We’re an experienced team of product developers and engineers and have already built several prototypes, tested the product on ourselves and sourced most of the required component manufacturers.
We're using a product development firm with years of direct experience developing and building innovative wearable and medical devices similar to ours. In spite of our best efforts, you never know what might cause delays in manufacturing (component shortages, national holidays, etc.). While we may not be able to promise 100% accuracy on delivery dates, we promise transparency to keep our backers informed and up-to-date on our progress.We've put a lot on the line for this initiative. While we expect there will be twists and turns, we are committed to delivering on our promises.
 
 


[1] Raggi Francesco, Vallesi Giuseppe. Intravenous Laser Blood Irradiation in Sports Medicine. Schmerz & Akupunktur 3/2008; 34:126-129
[2] Naoya Ieda†, Yuji Hotta†, Naoki Miyata†, Kazunori Kimura†, and Hidehiko Nakagawa*†‡ Photomanipulation of Vasodilation with a Blue-Light-Controllable Nitric Oxide Releaser. J. Am. Chem. Soc., 2014. 4/2014; DOI: 10.1021
   

_________________________________________________________________________
 
The Quantlet is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease and has not been examined by the FDA or other regulatory agencies. Consult your physician before beginning any exercise program.
The Quantlet product is protected by one or more patent applications in the United States and throughout the world. The Quantlet and the Quantlet logo are trademarks of Quantum Dynamics LLC. 
 
Pictures shown are for illustration purposes only. Actual product may vary due to product enhancements.
Copyright © 2015-2017 Quantum Dynamics LLC. All rights reserved.

story:
A Powerful Earthquake with the magnitude of 7.9 struck Nepal early Saturday afternoon (11:56 am), on April 25th, killing over 70,40 people and left over 14,340 injured and these numbers are estimated to rise. It was the worse tremor to hit the country in over 80 years. The 7.9 magnitude earthquake struck 50 miles north-west of Nepal's capital. Over 100 aftershocks, one registering as high as 6.7 magnitude, has hit since. There are villages/Towns which are completely destroyed leaving no houses livable. There have been several avalanches across the Himalayan mountain range that have impacted hundreds of trekkers and mountaineers during Nepal’s peak tourist season. We fear that many villages, with anywhere between 500-1000 people in the hilly areas, are completely buried and trapped under the earth. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are in need of Medical Support and wheelchair for the insured Victims of the Earthquake in NEPAL.

story:
About Me

Hello my name is Shawntel Patterson. I am a sophomore. I play tennis; it is one of my biggest passions. That is why I started this campaign.  I am also very dedicated to what I do. I live in a household that consists of my father and I .I’ve been living with my father since I was 5 month old. 4 years ago my father was injured; and is slowly trying to recooperate, he is now on permanent disability. My mother is deceased, so we don’t have the funds to enter enough tennis tournaments or pay for tennis lessons. But my father does all that he can to help. When i become a professioinal tennis player i would like to give back to the less fourtunate.

 

What I Need

I need your donations to help me pay for tournaments and strategic tennis lessons. Your donation is listed by price in the perks to the right. Any donation is excepted. (:

 

Tournaments(total): $360

Lessons(total): $1760 

 

Ways You Can Reach Me

If you have any questions or concerns you can always e-mail me directly at epatterson001@ca.rr.com. If you have any tennis tips you would like to share please post them at shawntelpatterson.weebly.com

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Share my campaign on your facebook or twitter websites. Send the link to my IndiegoGoGo campaign to all of your friends, family, and co-workers.  Tell everyone about this project and encourage them to support it.  

Thanks for caring and thanks for sharing.

story:
Our friend Emily needs a hand!

We have a friend, Emily, a very special friend to all of us and right now she needs not only our help, but your help as well.

Five and a half years ago she was diagnosed with breast cancer and decided to follow an alternative path of healing. She valiantly embarked upon an extraordinary journey that led her to writing a book called 'Cancer Healed Me' which is one of the most positive books you can read on the subject!

This in turn, led her to travel and give talks on healing. Not only does Emily say that the cancer healed her mind, but you can actually see it - she's full of light, humour and a bundle of laughter. Her positive energy and grace blows away all her friends.

However, this week our friend Emily discovered that the cancer has spread to her bones.

Emily, who has so little fear, believes in quality of life not quantity and so is committed to 'dancing to the light' with grace, dignity and laughter.  She has chosen to continue her gentle path of alternative healing as her body cannot cope with 'nuclear' medicine. Since she was diagnosed nearly six years ago, five of her friends who were also were diagnosed decided to heal with traditional medicine or 'chemotherapy' but they have all since passed on. And the doctors have said she should have passed on years ago too!  This makes Emily even more determined to continue to follow her unique path.

WHY WE FEEL SHE DESERVES OUR HELP, AND YOURS

It is expensive staying alive!! Emily has very little money. She has not worked for the past five years as she has dedicated her time to healing and researching cancer for her book. Yet her book only generates an income from Amazon of $.17 a copy.  And so far she's never been paid!

Yet despite this she has been inspired to write a new book called 'Follow Your Bliss, If Not What's The Point?'  It is her contribution to awakening people to follow their heart, for she believes this is the best preventative medicine ever.

Her imagination and creativity inspire all who meet her. Over the years she has created a home for adolescent mothers in Cusco, Peru – an incredible place that has won awards for the best women’s project in South America; a library in Nicaragua and a healing convent in France. She has raised funds for children in Africa and was instrumental in building a well in the jungle in Peru.

She is now contemplating the creation of a documentary to help people face death with more peace and acceptance. Her eighteen years of meditation practice has led her to being in a wonderful place of peace that could inspire others as they make their transitions to the light. And with me, she is still determined to help run retreats in Ibiza, assisting others to create changes in their lives and so live more fully and passionately.

She said the other day that she most definitely was not going to be sitting around thinking about bones and cancer but live passionately until the very end. So, she has decided to go with a friend to the Gerson Clinic in Hungary, which has an amazing reputation for healing cancer through a very special diet. This journey will cost 7,000 Euros and in typical Emily style she has booked her place for the second week of September trusting the universe will bring the funds to her account! 

So you see, our friend Emily is no ordinary “cancer” victim – she believes she created this for her soul to grow.  Her vision on healing is inspiring and touches everyone who meets her. Now it is definitely her time to receive from us, and you!

WHAT WE WISH TO MANIFEST FOR EMILY

Despite being faced with this latest challenge she has not lost her courage and is determined to keep creating and living to the very last breath she takes. 

We need to help her financially and wish to raise $30,000 to pay for her alternative treatments and medicines, the rent for an apartment to live in, as she does not own a home, and all the other expenses that are involved in "dancing to the light".

It is not a fortune that we're asking for, but we wish to see our friend live out this passage with no extra stress so she can continue with her talks, finish her book and create her documentary.

Anything, anything at all you can contribute to our friend Emily would be wonderful.  Thank you in advance for your generosity and love.

If you need more information please feel free to contact me: Tristan@TristanSoames.com

Or visit Emily's blog www.dancetothelight.blogspot.com

You can see or buy her book ‘Cancer Healed Me’ on Amazon here

Alternatively you can see a video of Emily talking about her book on YouTube.com here 

And the home for adolescent mothers in Cusco she built is here - www.mantay.org

story:
WHAT IS MAVUNO HARVEST?

Mavuno Harvest is a new food company started by a Peace Corps volunteer who spent over 2 years living and working with a small farming community in rural Kenya.  The idea was to try something new - step outside of the world of traditional 'development,' yet still have a positive impact on the lives of impoverished rural African farmers.

The result - truly amazing, delicious and healthy dried fruits grown and cared for by small scale farmers.  We source everything from subsistence farmers whose only income comes from the land they cultivate.

Best bananas you'll ever try!

SO HERE'S THE DEAL:

We already know this dried fruit is the tastiest on the market today.  Seriously.  Our customers love us and we even received glowing reviews from the National Association for the Specialty Food Trade (NASFT).  Plus, we already know that our dried fruit is a great healthy snack - full of energy - with absolutely nothing added - no sugar, no preservatives, no coloring.

What we need now is to add a few certifications to our fruit to truly make it the best we can.  The fruit is already grown organically, and our whole business model is based on helping farmers and treating them fairly.  So now we want to have the food officially certified for both organic and fair trade.  Unfortunately, this can get a bit expensive!

Getting these certifications will help us grow our market - and the more we grow our market, the more money will actually roll into the African farming communities responsible for these amazing snacks.  Think about it - its a great concept right?

Imagine the extra income and employment we can create!

THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN!

By contributing now, you’ll be a helping us pay for these certifications and bring delicious, all natural, Fair Trade, organic dried fruit to you!  BUT even more importantly, you’ll be helping our farmers in Kenya and Uganda have access to things like clean water, new roads, community centers, and a way of life that we want to help them be able to afford in exchange for all their hard work.

This is your chance to give African farmers a better shot - while at the same time enjoying a delicious snack which is good for mind, body and soul.  Feed your body, feed the world!

Mavuno Harvest founder Phil Hughes with some of the women who dry the fruit

Thanks so much for reading about our project.  Please check out the website and our awesome perks.  Contribute a few bucks and get our awesome dried fruit - or give a little more and get some sweet gear (see hats and tees below)!  

With your support - we can reach that next level and truly make an impact! Think about that when you're enjoying your awesome perks!!

(PS - If you choose a perk with a t-shirt or hat - please let us know your size and style preference!!)

Sweet t-shirts - take your pick!

Let us know which hat you prefer!

story:
On July 19, 2014, I will be competing in the Piseco Lake Triathlon (NY) as part of my on-going national campaign, Tri For Eyes, to raise awareness and monies to fund innovative stem cell-based therapies aimed at finding a cure for blinding eye diseases like the one (x-linked Retinitis Pigmentosa [XLRP]) my 14-year old son Cole Nowak is battling against at the present moment.  XLRP is a rare genetic eye disease of which there is known cure. That simply means we are in a race against time to help Cole and find a cure and I need your help.

I created Tri For Eyes in an effort to have others learn more about how the Neural Stem Cell Institute (NCSI) is successfully generating stem cell-based therapies to treat blinding retinal diseases, including Cole’s eye disease.  NCSI (www.nstemcell.org) is a 501(c) (3) non-profit organization.

Tri For Eyes calls for me to continue to complete in triathlons whenever I can to raise awareness and monies on behalf of Neural Stem Cell Institute (NCSI) and my son who I love very much.  To date, I have completed triathlons in New York (2), Massachusetts (2), New Hampshire (1), Vermont (1) and Rhode Island (1).

I am proud to state that even with twelve (12) screws holding my left ankle together, and having had two lower back and two knee surgeries, I continue to have the passion and heart to find a cure for Cole and others like him by completing and competing in these triathlons.  As my son, Cole says, “Dad, you have a lot of work to do to get into shape like a 'real'  triathlete.”  He is right – I am not pretty but I just keep plugging along. Even though having already lost over 35% of his total vision and almost his entire night vision, Cole continues to bravely meet this challenge head-on.  I will follow his attitude and continue to do these triathlons until a cure is found.  Thank you for your support.  It means more than you know to me and my family and others like Cole.

story:
What We Do

Remember the tricorder from Star Trek? It's a multi-purpose sensor that, with a peripheral attachment, becomes a medical scanner. Now, we found a way to merge a transducer with any tab or even a phone, forming the first pen-sized ultrasound machine. The communicator meets the tricorder, at least within the limits of real-life technology.

Now we have a technology to build the ultra-low cost wireless ultrasound imager that can be connected to any tab, smartphone or computer to show images of an unborn baby on device's screen.

The pen-sized wireless device works in a similar way to existing ultrasound scanners, using pulses of high frequency sound to build up a images.

ROXX control app will be available on Android, Apple IOS and Windows.

Our story

"It was my own experience of becoming a father and going through the whole antenatal process that prompted me to start the project,” explains the Andrey Fedorov, founder of ROXX.

“I was sat with my wife looking at our child on the screen, we realised how privileged we were to have access to this kind of care and it was my wife who suggested that I could apply my knowledge  to try to make this more affordable.”

Also our early stage prototype participated in Intel App innovation Contest (Intel AIC) and won a stage 2 prize!

ROXX at Medical Units

UN statistics estimate more than 250,000 women die annually from complications during pregnancy or childbirth, almost all of them – 99 per cent – in developing countries.  Tragically, most of these deaths are avoidable and a lack of access to equipment is cited as one of the key factors.

Imaging to obtain even the simplest information such as the child’s position in the womb or how it is developing is simply not available to women in many parts of the world:

* it is real image of unborn child acquired by ROXX prototype.

ROXX can be used to provide medical units working in the world’s poorest nations with basic, antenatal information that could save the lives of hundreds of thousands of women and children. 


ROXX at Home

ROXX can accurately measure fat thickness and calculate Body Fat % and weight distribution by analyzying ultrasound waves reflecting from your fat and muscles.

For example, scanning with the ROXX allows you to directly see fat and muscle layers as shown below:

* it is real image of muscle and fat layers acquired by ROXX prototype.

Risks and Challenges

ROXX don't have the power and depth of a larger hospital grade machine, obviously, and in some cases doctors will want traditional scans. But this device's strengths are its portability and cost.

Please Join Us

Help us complete our work on ROXX, and become the pioneers in Next Gen ultrasound imaging. 

Back ROXX – and become part of a revolution and building a healthier world.


Technical Details

Pen-sized ROXX device contains 3 Mhz ultrasound transducer with acoustical lens, high-speed computing unit with ADC/DAC for image synthesis, IMU (inertial measurement unit) for capture scaning trajectory, Bluetooth module and rechargeable battery with USB charging port.

story:
Thank you for your interest!

At Sun LifeLight, we've revolutionized light therapy by building smart, personal sunlight delivery systems specifically designed to be used at work, school or home by anyone that wants to operate at their peak!  

The system is uniquely designed to make it effective for use by computer using office professionals that spend most of their workday indoors. With this simple yet sophisticated and patent protected system, those that don't receive the energizing benefits of being in the sun while at work, can still gain those natural, energy amplifying, mood enhancing and productivity boosting attributes at or around their computer workstations!

Corporations and individuals alike, benefit by virtually transporting their workstations to sun drenched destinations!

Computer-using office professionals, students and home based workers do not receive enough sunlight during the workday to maintain a healthy existence. As a result, It's virtually impossible for anyone that works indoors to operate at their peak. Depression, obesity, and type 2 diabetes are at epidemic proportions and have all been shown to have links to sunlight deprivation. The resulting absenteeism, presenteeism and a general malaise in the workplace, as productivity demands continue to increase, has proven costly for employers and individuals alike.

Please, find the following report from Thomas Jefferson University Department of Neurology, that succinctly explains how humans are "wired" to benefit from the sun. 

The simple solution: Bring the effective, soft, “sky blue” color of a bright sunny day to every workstation...The result, a happier, healthier and more productive workforce and or individual, within days.

A recent report by Shadab Rahman, PhD. from Brigham & Women's hospital Boston, MA shows how Sun LifeLight’s technology is at the forefront of this healthful, productivity boosting revolution.

About 20 months ago, we set off on a mission to bring the healthful benefits of the sun inside to help employers and employees alike, create healthy, exciting, energetic and productive work environments! 

Our journey began with a love for the outdoors and the constant desire to be in the sun. 

After months of research and development with an exceptionally talented team of technologists and medical professionals, we were able to deliver the LifeLight prototypes to an amazing collection of enterprise clients.

Those partners including TJX, BAE, Barclays, Digital Credit Union (DCU) and Todd & Weld, to name a few, provided valuable feedback that allowed us to optimize the production design. 

Now we need your help to make the LifeLight a production reality!

Through your support and backing of this IndieGoGo campaign, not only will you receive the first and only natural, energy boosting, personal, sunlight delivery system, but your support will help Sun LifeLight make this life changing system available to all that spend so much of their day indoors, no matter where they live!

Many of us continue to struggle through the worst winter on record (Boston, MA is in the midst of the snowiest winter in its long history)! We drew inspiration from these long dark days to ensure that although the harsh weather will inevitably return, thanks to the LifeLight, many of us will be basking in the healthful benefits of the sun no matter what the weather, season or time of day.

System Overview

Used as you would an ordinary desk lamp, this unique system allows users to interactively decide exactly how much sun they feel they need on a daily basis. A mobile application controls and monitors the light wirelessly, while the system actually gets smarter over time. Using its sophisticated algorithm, the app recommends the appropriate amount of sunlight each and every day based on a variety of inputs including weather, sleep quality, personal schedules and even favorite athletic team schedules.

LifeLight Touch...Stylish and Elegant Simplicity

  • High tech brushed aluminum desk lamp
  • Color selected LEDs
  • Controlled using simple swipes of a finger on a glass touchscreen panel built into the base
  • Infinitely adjust the brightness of the soft, sky blue light
  • Adjust the timer for up to 8 hours of use with a simple swipe of the finger
  • Uniquely flexible positioning system allows any user to direct the effective light into the eyes from above to eliminate glare, the way nature intended 
  • Integrated USB port in the base for charging of any mobile device

SunSeeker App...Sophisticated Utility

  • Personalized Control and Monitoring Mobile App
  • Bluetooth connection to the LifeLight
  • Provides individually Customized, daily recommended sunlight levels for maximum benefit
  • Built with proprietary algorithm using Multiple Internet of Things (IoT) inputs such as:
  •  Weather
  •  Personal schedule
  • Athletic team schedules
  • Wearable device data such as sleep quality, etc.
  • Interactive algorithm learns each users optimum sunlight levels for peak performance

  • The Only Effective Colored Wavelength -The LifeLight delivers only therapeutically effective wavelength of light ~480nm (sky blue). It therefore operates at far less intensity while being more effective than any other solution. 
  • Connected and Responsive App -The LifeLight is the first app controlled, “Internet of things” (IoT) connected light therapy device and leverages a multitude of external sensor based inputs No other product has the ability to automatically incorporate outside variables and user dynamics that directly impact the amount of sunlight that is most effective for each individual user. 
  • Customized Sunlight Algorithm -By learning each user’s personal preferences the app algorithmically calculates the best amount of sunlight each and every day. 
  • Reduces Light Pollution –In an office environment filled with competing visual stimuli (monitors, overhead lighting, etc.) the LifeLight only adds the specific wavelength of light required and reduces visual stress. 
  • Ergonomic Design -Unlike other bulky and disruptive light therapy products it’s unique compact and flexible form factor was developed to direct the light down into the eye and out of the field of view, the way nature intended. Position the LifeLight to shine down from above your computer display and you'll receive all of the effective light energy without even noticing the LifeLight is there!

    • Finalist in Massachusetts Medical Device Development Center (M2D2), New Venture Competition. This very well attended event at the University of Massachusetts Lowell on April 1, 2015 brought many visitors to the Sun LifeLight display. The competition will announce the winners on April 16, 2015. We shall keep you posted.

    http://www.uml.edu/Research/Centers/M2D2/2015-NVC-Showcase.aspx

    Top 50 Finalist out of over 1,900 global applicants in Sir Richard Branson's Extreme Tech Challenge late 2014 into early 2015. Presented at the Monster Products Pavilion at the 2015 Consumer Electronics Show (CES2015).

     http://extremetechchallenge.com/ 

    Finalist in STAPLES (Fall 2014) Crowd2Shelf Contest out of close to 1,000 global applicants.

     https://www.fundable.com/crowd2shelf

     


    Our talented team, coming from diverse backgrounds including telecommunications infrastructure equipment manufactures, semiconductor manufacturers and the medical professions have come together to make this happen. With our vast experience in designing and building high volume, complex software and hardware systems along with the clinical expertise in the use of products similar to the LifeLight and your support, creates a unique opportunity for us to deliver this life changing solution for all that happen to spend most of their workday indoors.

    Gary Grimard

    Founder & CEO: More than 25 Years of technology leadership experience including business development, sales, marketing, product innovation and start-up methodology. Gary’s experience includes ownership of a technology sales firm he led to over $225M in annual sales. His efforts with Sun Lifelight are centered around the product architecture, leading the development and manufacturing resources along with fundraising, marketing, orchestrating the go-to-market strategy and building the team.

    Alison Todd LICSW / ABD

    Co-Founder & Product Advocate: Having over 20 years of experience as a Clinical Psychologist and behavioral health leader in Boston area hospitals, Alison focuses primarily on evaluation, research and advocacy within the client base to help evangelize the product and expand its success.

    Our Extended Team (with thanks and gratitude)

    • My Point Exactly(Video Production and Sales): Keith O’Brien
    • Fikst Product Development(Mechanical Engineering):  Doug Sabin, Paul Sabin and Adrianne Jalbert
    • Future Electronics(Electronic Components and Lighting Design):  Bob Duperey, Dan Sullivan
    • Design Turn(Industrial Design): Matt Kressy
    • TMA(Software Application Development): Gian Le Kong, Hong Tran and the team
    • Dai Ma(Electronic Assembly)
    • Bluefish Digital(Marketing and Social Media Initiatives): Jeffrey Hodnett and Jeremy France
    • Aaron Spagnolo(Photography)
    • Chris Clifford  (Sales Adviser)
    • Rex Trailer Studios(Video Productions) Mike Bavaro and Jillian Trailer-Rollock
    • Ed Lombardo(Software Lead)
    • Jeffery Wang(Hardware Lead)
    • Duane Dreger(Patent Counsel Cesari and McKenna, LLP)
    • Rick Kinney(Corporate Counsel  Lynch, Brewer, Hoffman & Fink, LLP)
    • Steve Morin(Ronin Digital, Web Development)

    We are thrilled with the results of our prototype build. With those prototypes now being evaluated by enterprise clients, it is time to venture into the volume manufacturing of these systems.

    With the support of our IndieGoGo backers, we will be able to bring this vision to a production reality satisfying the needs of so many that have been looking for our solution given the harsh winter many of us continue to suffer through this year and the knowledge that it will be back all too soon.

    The backing we are seeking is to complete the production design modifications and tooling necessary to fabricate the LifeLight in volume. That effort is underway and will be accelerated as we approach our fundraising goal. With the expectation of a 4 week turnaround on the machining of the tools necessary and an additional 4 weeks for our first production assembly, the 90 day expectation to deliver on the rewards that our backers have purchased, is a realistic one.

    Although there are always "bumps in the road", our team has been through them before and we'll always find a way to overcome any obstacle. Communication is key and our backers can rest assured that the transparency with which we operate will be refreshing and comforting as we navigate to that bright sun at the end of the tunnel.


    • My office has plenty of windows and lots of natural light...so I don't need a LifeLight, right?

      The LifeLight brings the sun indoors no matter what the weather, season or time of day. Although natural light from the sun is best, unless you are truly outside on a bright sunlit day, it’s unlikely you will receive the amount of colored light spectrum (sky blue or 480nm) necessary to bring the healthful benefits of the sun to you, no matter how many windows your home or office happens to have. The distinction we draw is in the physiological benefits gained by receiving the right amount of that sky blue light. Windows do vary in technology and makeup but invariably, the energizing benefits of sunlight are drastically reduced as the light passes through those windows. Add to that the further reduction in sunlight during less sunny days and the changing of the seasons. There is however, a psychological benefit of outdoor views through those same windows. Windows alone do not deliver nearly enough of the proper light to significantly impact human physiological wellness.


    • Will I get a tan by using the LifeLight?

      The LifeLight does not deliver any UV or near UV rays from which, exposure to the skin produces more melanin which rises to the surface and darkens the skin.


    • Will the LifeLight work for everyone even if they live in a sunny location?

      Yes. Science has shown that non-visual sensors in our eyes manage and control a complex sequence of events within all of us that balance “sleep / wake” hormones along with many other functions. These sensors are particularly responsive to the color of a bright sunlit sky (sky blue) and when exposed to those colors initiate those events making us healthy, happy, more energized and productive during the day. Those that work indoors during prime daylight hours are deprived of these life giving benefits from the sun. Today’s indoor lighting does not deliver nearly enough of the effective “sky blue” color to allow the body's sleep/wake regulation to occur properly no matter where we live. Even sitting next to a window does not allow nearly enough of that particular sky blue light to reach the eye with enough intensity to allow our bodies to work properly. The LifeLight changes that by bringing the sun’s life giving colors indoors in a smart, personal lighting system that is easy to use on or around any computer workstation.


    • Do you get vitamin D from the LifeLight?

      Not yet. The LifeLight does not deliver any UV or near UV rays from which the skin produces vitamin D. Our scientists and engineers are however, working on a safe and effective way to stimulate vitamin D production using our lamp. One day we expect to include this as another feature of our system.


    • How long should I use the LifeLight every day?

      The color, brightness and duration recommended for peak effectiveness varies from person to person and day to day. Variables such as weather, schedules, how restful your sleep was, how stressful the day has been, the day of the week, etc. are used by the LifeLight’s learning system and will help you find the optimum settings each and every day to achieve your personal best.


    • Is the LifeLight safe?

      The LifeLight is absolutely safe and can be infinitely adjusted for maximum comfort and performance.


    • What time of year should I use it?

      Those of us that work indoors, regardless of geographic location, will benefit by using the LifeLight year round.


    • Will the glare bother me?

      Unlike our competitors, the LifeLight can be positioned out of the field of view while still allowing the light to effectively enter the eye thereby eliminating glare.

story:
Hi my name is Sharron Allen, I am the wife of Gregory Allen, we have been married for 8 1/2 years. We collectively have (4) children and (7) grand's.

This account has been set up due to an unforeseen  illness that has befallen our family. In July my husband Gregory b.k.a Manor was called back into the doctors office after his annual D.O.T physical for additional test after his initial test results were unsatisfactory.

The results of the secondary test lead his primary doctor to put him in contact with a surgeon, Dr. Kavada who then started his own workup and was informed by him that he needed his gallbladder removed, ASAP after which it was discovered that there damage to the bile ducts that were detached from the gallbladder . Another procedure was done in an attempt to repair the ducts, physicians at Wakemed then informed him that their attempts, although somewhat went successful this procedure did not take care of the problem. The physicians at Wakemed suggested he seek the help of a specialist in (kidney/liver) field which lead us to UNC Chapel Hill Memorial Hospital. Now September and after six procedures he is still in the hospital our care has been excellent and we are optimistic through first our "FAITH" that he will make a full recovery.

Manor has been unable to work for nearly 2 months and I have barely worked due to low patient census over the last few months and recent unit closing, as well as the need to be at the hospital to take care of my husband.

WE, are asking for YOUR support any support that you may be able to give, we are currently struggling with mortgage, insurance, gas, general everyday expenses and meals at the hospital for myself (we do share his meals when possible, smile).......Where there is a will there is a way! haha; general cost of living has made our situation even more difficult. We realize that we are in stressful economic times. So again, ANY amount of help would be greatly appreciated!!!

May God bless and keep you all...............Thank you in advance,

 

Gregory & Sharron Allen

Hi my name is Sharron Allen, I am the wife of Gregory Allen, we have been married for 8 1/2 years. We collectively have (4) children and (7) grand's. 
This account has been set up due to an unforeseen  illness that has befallen our family. In July my husband Gregory b.k.a Manor was called back into the doctors office after his annual D.O.T physical for additional test after his initial test results were unsatisfactory. 
The results of the secondary test lead his primary doctor to put him in contact with a surgeon, Dr. Kavada who then started his own workup and was informed by him that he needed his gallbladder removed, ASAP after which it was discovered that there damage to the bile ducts that were detached from the gallbladder . Another procedure was done in an attempt to repair the ducts, physicians at Wakemed then informed him that their attempts, although somewhat went successful this procedure did not take care of the problem. The physicians at Wakemed suggested he seek the help of a specialist in (kidney/liver) field which lead us to UNC Chapel Hill Memorial Hospital. Now September and after six procedures he is still in the hospital our care has been excellent and we are optimistic through first our "FAITH" that he will make a full recovery.
Manor has been unable to work for nearly 2 months and I have barely worked due to low patient census over the last few months and recent unit closing, as well as the need to be at the hospital to take care of my husband. 
WE, are asking for YOUR support any support that you may be able to give, we are currently struggling with mortgage, insurance, gas, general everyday expenses and meals at the hospital for myself (we do share his meals when possible, smile).......Where there is a will there is a way! haha; general cost of living has made our situation even more difficult. We realize that we are in stressful economic times. So again, ANY amount of help would be greatly appreciated!!!
May God bless and keep you all...............Thank you in advance,
 
Gregory & Sharron Allen

story:
Short Summary

We all know how devastating cancer is and how hard is the fight to cure it, in all it's different forms. I myself feel, as I know most people do, when something happens to a child it is that much more tragic. NO child should have to face the horrors of cancer. And any parent will tell you there is no greater pain than the loss of a child. If there is a sadder sight than a child or teen without hair, lying in a hospital bed, hooked up to tubes I cannot think of it. It moves one to tears. I am not a parent and have not had this disease touch any young person in my family, immediate or otherwise, nor do I know anyone who personally lost a child to cancer. For this I am eternally grateful. But this has only served to deepen my committment to do my part to end childhood cancer, so no child or parent should have to suffer this ever again. Please help me make this a reality!

 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is $10,000. I did recent fundraisers for St Jude's Childrens Hospital and the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society and while I was glad to present them with checks for $1000 and $1500 respectively I really want to step up my goals now. I would love to present each of these wonderful organizations a check for $5000 each.

 

The Impact

The work St Jude's has done for decades, after being founded by the late great Danny Thomas and carried on by his beautiful and talented daughter Marlo, has been extraordinary. NO child is ever turned away and the survival/cure rate is increasing every year! Their constant two-pronged approach of treatment and care combined with research has done wonders. But they will be the first to tell you there is so far to go.

The Leukemia and Lymphoma Society is relentless in it's quest to cure this particularly horrible form of cancer, which is the NUMBER ONE cancer that strikes children and young adults. Leukemia has been called the "Child Killer", and while great strides have been made so much more is to be done. The LLS is leading the way!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Anytime you can, please give to St Judes or the LLS. One can become a sponsor of a child for just $20/month at St Judes. Both organizations accept recurring monthly donations through credit card, bank account or paypal. And each can be added to a will for  one-time or monthly donation. Also, join their Facebook pages, send away for information, have a local fundraiser (both organizations will help you all the way from planning to the event itself) and any other way you can help raise money and even more importantly, awareness. Together we can defeat childhood cancer forever!

story:
Im trying to help out my boyfriends mother (pictured) who is an amazing woman. She spends most of her free time, and money, to help out a multitude of orphanages in Mexicali, as we live in a border town. This particular little girl is an orphan in one the orphanages she helps out, and her eye condition was a sudden. They took her already to a doctor that they could afford, and the doctor brushed it off as a malformation of the face, maybe a tumor, and said if she really wanted help to go to another doctor. Since this little girl is in Mexico, everything is normally paid for in cash, so any donation goes to paying for a second opinion at a specialist who would actually help Luisa. Thank you and feel free to ask me any questions you have. I'm just trying to help out someone who, if they could, would pay for it themselves.


UPDATE: the orphanage found some family members of hers and she is currently with family but we are still going to help with whatever we can! Thank you for any donations so far! My boyfriends mother is more than willing to take your calls (given you speak Spanish) about what's going in with Luisa and can also put you into contact with the woman currently taking care of her! Just email me for more details!

story:
About Me

My name is Alex Foley. Currently, I'm a third year Neuroscience BSc student at the University of Sussex in Brighton, UK, projected to achieve a first degree honours. During the past year, I have developed a very close relationship with Prof. Louise Serpell, a professor of Biochemistry at my university. She has generously supervised me for a summer studentship in her lab following my second year and my third year project, entitled, 'Investigating prion-like strains as the basis of phenotypic variation in the tauopathies.' During these projects, Louise has given me invaluable experience and a genuine passion for investigating Alzheimer's disease. 

This being my final year of university, I have been very keen to secure a position in a lab for next year. Louise has been so kind as to offer me a position in her lab to carry out my PhD research, but unfortunately she does not have enough funding to cover my tuition. Originally, I'm from Maine in the US, which has some significant implications for the cost of my PhD. Firstly, as I am not an EU citizen, the tuition fees per year are £17,000 per year as opposed to the £3,996 an EU citizen would pay, which totals £51,000. Secondly, I am not eligible for most forms of funding. Many UK based organisations dictate that the funding they give out goes to UK citizens, and the major sources of funding for US students in the UK stipulate that applicants cannot have previously studied in the UK. Of course I am willing to take out significant student loan debt in order to carry out this research, but this would leave me significantly worse off after I finished my degree. Any amount of money donated would go directly towards tuition fees, allowing me to take on less debt.

Alzheimer's research has truly become a passion of mine during my undergraduate degree. I constantly find myself blathering on about new journal articles I've recently read to my friends and family. I hope to someday become a professor and carry out my own research, and this PhD would be the first step down this path.

About the Research

Alzheimer's disease is a crippling, progressive neurodegenerative disease that, with the ageing population, is going to become a significant burden on the healthcare system. It is projected to affect 115.4 million people worldwide by 2050, a staggering number that demonstrates the urgent need for an effective treatment. What's more, anyone with a connection to the disease can attest to the personal toll it takes on its sufferers and their loved ones. It is for these reasons that the benefits Alzheimer's research is so crucial. I truly believe that I am capable of significantly contributing to this research, given the opportunity. Already in my undergraduate degree I have carried out research that is now being included in a manuscript that David Sanders of Washington University is submitting to the journal Neuron, a unique honour. I can think of nothing more I would like to dedicate my life and career to more than the study and eventual curing of this terrible degree.

Specifically, this PhD research would investigate one of the two proteins involved in Alzheimer’s disease, tau. Under basal condition, tau provides structural support to neurons via microtubule binding, but in Alzheimer’s disease it becomes hyperphosphorylated and aggregates to form neurofibrillary tangles. Recent work, including my dissertation, has shown that there are a few key similarities between the tauopathies and a fascinating set of diseases called the prionopathies, which include mad cow disease and Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease. These similarities include spreading pathology and phenotypic variation. My research would investigate the molecular basis of these key characteristics of tau.

Contact

Any questions? Feel free to tweet me @AlexCFoley, or send me an email: AlexCFoley@gmail.com


I thank each and every donator from the bottom of my heart for helping me achieve my goal.

Best wishes,

Alex Foley

story:
Short Summary

We are a community-based competitive Quidditch team in Winnipeg, Manitoba.  As the first team in the province, we are dedicated to improving our skills while bringing the game of Quidditch to a wider audience throughout Manitoba and the prairies. As a community-based team, we do not have the support of a university to help fund our team so we are asking for your help!

This campaign is to raise money to subsidize our travel expenses to get to the Quidditch Canada National Championships in Vancouver, BC.  After placing 2nd in the Western Regional Championships, we are excited to bring our little team from the heart of the nation out to Nationals to show all the big players how we kick butt, Manitoba-style!

Quidditch is a trans-positive, inclusive sport and we pride ourselves on maintaining that inclusive spirit in everything we do both at home and abroad.  As part of our goal of inclusivity, we want to mitigate the affect that travel costs can have on anyone's ability to participate in our sport.  Anything you can spare to help us reach our goal will only help to grow and foster this spirit and this sport in Canada, and especially in Manitoba.

What We Need & What You Get

As you may or may not know, Canada is really big,* and Winnipeg is literally in the middle making travelling exceptionally expensive for us, no matter where we go.  In considering our options for how to get to Nationals, we looked at driving, but a 24 hour road trip each way is not feasible for any of our players due to work, school and other commitments.  It would also significantly impact our competitiveness to spend 2 days (with breaks) in a car before the tournament.  Thus, we are left with flying as the only viable option.

A round trip flight to Vancouver from Winnipeg costs approximately  $550 - $750, depending on a number of different factors.  Using a low ballpark figure of $600 and a team size of 14 (our current roster, excluding our teammates from Regina and Ottawa), our estimated costs to get the team to Nationals and back are $8,400.  Adding in a buffer for Indiegogo fees, costs associated with printing and shipping perks and unforeseen complications, we arrived at our funding goal of $12,600.

We have a number of awesome perks for you in exchange for your support!

Undying Gratitude

No matter how much you pledge, we will love you forever and show that love in a consensual, platonic and probably social media-centered way.

STICKERS!!!

Our amazing team designers (who are also responsible for our amazing jerseys) designed a beautiful team crest for us:

For just $5 you can get your very own copy of this crest ON A STICKER!!!

Our designers also put together a gorgeous set of 4 stickers for each of the positions on a Quidditch team - Beater, Chaser, Keeper & Seeker.  You're going to want them.  You can get any single one of these, of your choice, for only $5! And, if that wasn't good enough already, you can get ALL 4 PLUS our beautiful crest for only $15!!! That's $10 in savings!

PROFESSIONAL PHOTOS

If you pledge over $10, you will get access to an online gallery of full size (up to 16.2MP, depending on cropping, etc) watermark free copies of every picture our Fearless Leader (Quidditch Canada Staff Photographer Jason "jalestro" Rosenberg) takes at Nationals.  These pictures will be fully edited, retouched and awesome.

On top of that, we'll send you a 4"x6" print of your favourite picture from the set ABSOLUTELY FREE!!!

Want more photo-licious goodness? Pledge over $20 and you get 5 PRINTS OF YOUR CHOICE!!!

(For prints bigger than 4"x6" message us and we will work something out).

QUIDDITCH CANADA T-SHIRTS!

We still have some Quidditch Canada T-shirts left over from a previous local fundraising campaign.  For only $30 you can get one of these beautiful white Gildan tees with the Quidditch Canada logo centred on the front along with all 5 stickers and prints from above!

These shirts are EXTREMELY LIMITED in quantity, and we won't be printing anymore so MAKE SURE TO PICK THE RIGHT SIZE AND CUT when choosing your perk for these shirts.

EXCLUSIVE WINNIPEG WHOMPING WILLOWS CREST T-SHIRTS

Did you see that beautiful crest up above? Do you want it on a t-shirt to go with your awesome sticker? At the $40 tier, you can get just that! These shirts will be printed on high-quality American Apparel or Gildan tees in ROYAL BLUE (we are looking into pricing and colours on different brands of shirt). And, you also get all 5 stickers and prints to boot!

Bloody hell, that's a tight jersey, ain't it?

Ok, so I've been watching too much Orphan Black, but the point still stands.  Our jerseys are delightful, and now you can get one of your very own! Pledge $100 and we'll send you a customized (your own name and number) Whomping Willows Jersey made by Row West Clothing.  This even includes a fully customized only-available-on-these-jerseys "willow"-style font for the numbers.  You know you want one of these, heck, I already have one and I want another. (The $100 perk includes everything from the $20 perk as well as the jersey)

[VERY SLIGHT] Disclaimer: everyone else's jersey (including the ones you can order!) have 3 standard filled in hoops on the front, the "C" is for "cookie" also "captain".

Bigger and Better Rewards!

Want more than just a jersey? Check the perks on the side for combo-packs and Quidditch Party options!

DISCLOSURE

No matter if we hit our goal or not, some of our team will be going to Nationals.  All funds raised in this campaign will go towards lowering the cost for those who can afford the difference.  Ideally, we can also fully subsidize some players who can't afford the trip but are still an indispensable part of our team.

* You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the chemist's, but that's just peanuts to Canada. - Douglas Adams (with slight paraphrasing... maybe)

Risks & Challenges

All of our products are designed and either printed or ready to be printed.  We don't expect any problems in getting everything printed and shipped out to our backers.

That said, if we get a large number of pledges, there may be delays in putting together all of the packages and shipping them out.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have even a dollar to spare? Help us by sharing this campaign with all your friends! Get them to buy you a t-shirt!

story:
Hello, I'm...

…Mike, 27 years old, Father, and have Type 2 Diabetes.

…Melissa, 32 years old.  Wife, Mother, Career Professional and have Type 2 Diabetes.

…Uncle Bob, 57 years old.  Own a small business and have Type 2 Diabetes with complications.

…Joshua, 13 years old.  Student and have Type 2 Diabetes.

…Sarah, 14 years old.  Student, Joshua’s friend and have Prediabetes

…Mary, 47 years old.  Mother and career woman and have Prediabetes.

…Diabetes and I am the 7th Leading Cause of Death and growing.

Do you see someone you know in that list?  Based on the numbers you know several people of various ages with Diabetes.  And it’s statistically impossible for you not to know a lot of folks with Prediabetes because one in four have it, whether they know it or not.  That’s 78,000,000 people with Prediabetes in the United States.  Can you believe that?  25,000,000 others have Diabetes, but almost 8,000,000 don’t know it.  This cannot go on.  Diabetes is the biggest health risk facing the United States, and the World today. 

Did you know that HIV/Aids has caused about 600,000 deaths since 1981?  That’s terrible.  But, Diabetes will cause that many deaths in 2.5 years.  In just 2.5 years. 

Hello, I'm Phil Ruggiero and have Type 2 Diabetes.  I started a blog, solutionsfort2diabetes.com, to provide information and encouragement to those with Type 2 Diabetes.  But, the more I found out, the angrier I became because Diabetes is taking a terrible toll on the country and the world.  Forget the money lost; it's the lost lives and lost time with loved ones that did not have to happen.  I got angry because the research has shown since 2007 that Diabetes kills over 230,000 people every year and it's growing!  And yet it's buried on a fact sheet.

Diabetes is a public menace and must be beat.

It's time for WAR!

Declaration of War

Whereas Diabetes is a chronic disease in the United States that caused the death of 231,404 in 2007; that 18.8 million people are diagnosed with the disease, 7 million people with undiagnosed Diabetes, and 78 million people with Prediabetes;

And, whereas the total cost for Diabetes in the United States was estimated to be $218 Billion in 2007;

And, whereas in many cases Type 2 Diabetes can be controlled and managed once diagnosed;

And, whereas those who have Prediabetes do not have to get Diabetes - the condition can be reversed;

I am declaring war on Diabetes.  A take no prisoners approach to eradicating Diabetes in the US and the World.  To remove it from the list of 'chronic' diseases through education, encouragement, finding and scaling the best programs, and detecting and treating Prediabetes early.  To accomplish this I will use any tool that works to elevate public awareness and to treat the entire person so they thrive in their lives.

War On Diabetes Strategy

Every war needs a strategy, the War On Diabetes will:

  1. Increase awareness of Diabetes and Prediabetes through placement of news articles on the Internet and through traditional media.
  2. Promote the early detection of Prediabetes by making testing readily available by bringing the testing to where people are.
  3. Educate the public on how choices they are making now effect them later.
  4. Expose Diabetes for what it is - a deadly disease that can be controlled.
  5. Find the best available programs and scale them for a region, a country and the world.
  6. Create a place where those with Diabetes can find another with the disease.  It's a very lonely disease.

The war will not be won over-night, or in a year or two.  It's a generational war that must be fought and won.  Enlist in the War today.

Planning for War

The first step in the War is to become a recognized non-profit, which is why I am raising money.  Once that is accomplished, more funds and in-kind donations can be sought and accepted.  First, though, is getting recognized by the IRS and State.  The need breaks down this way:

IRS

$850

State

$350

Legal Fees

$750

Contingency

$600

Total

$2550

This is the first step in the War, and it needs you.  

Is there a member of your family with Diabetes?  Do you have a friend with Diabetes?  Do you have Diabetes?  Help me begin to fight the war for the sake of our children and grand-children.  Without sounding overly dramatic, it's a War of our furtue.  

Unite with us Against Diabetes.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know many of you will want to help, and the War needs you.  Some of the ways you can help are:

Are you an attorney and want to offer your services pro-bono?

Are you knowledgable about marketing and publicity?

Are you a CPA and want to help us set-up the correct accounting methods?

Have you beat Prediabetes, and there are a number of you, and want to tell your story for the webiste?

And, you can help by not getting Diabetes What do you need to do? Two simple things: Exercise and Diet.  Exercise just 30 minutes a day and maintain a lower carb diet.  If you are overweight, lose a few pounds.  A loss of ten - 10 - pounds greatly reduces your chances of getting Diabetes.  Will you do that?  By not becoming a Diabetes statistic you are making a huge donation to the WAR and to your life.

Thank you for everything you will do.
story_txt:
Hello, I'm...
…Mike, 27 years old, Father, and have Type 2 Diabetes.
…Melissa, 32 years old.  Wife, Mother, Career Professional and have Type 2 Diabetes.
…Uncle Bob, 57 years old.  Own a small business and have Type 2 Diabetes with complications.
…Joshua, 13 years old.  Student and have Type 2 Diabetes.
…Sarah, 14 years old.  Student, Joshua’s friend and have Prediabetes
…Mary, 47 years old.  Mother and career woman and have Prediabetes.
…Diabetes and I am the 7th Leading Cause of Death and growing.
Do you see someone you know in that list?  Based on the numbers you know several people of various ages with Diabetes.  And it’s statistically impossible for you not to know a lot of folks with Prediabetes because one in four have it, whether they know it or not.  That’s 78,000,000 people with Prediabetes in the United States.  Can you believe that?  25,000,000 others have Diabetes, but almost 8,000,000 don’t know it.  This cannot go on.  Diabetes is the biggest health risk facing the United States, and the World today. 
Did you know that HIV/Aids has caused about 600,000 deaths since 1981?  That’s terrible.  But, Diabetes will cause that many deaths in 2.5 years.  In just 2.5 years. 
Hello, I'm Phil Ruggiero and have Type 2 Diabetes.  I started a blog, solutionsfort2diabetes.com, to provide information and encouragement to those with Type 2 Diabetes.  But, the more I found out, the angrier I became because Diabetes is taking a terrible toll on the country and the world.  Forget the money lost; it's the lost lives and lost time with loved ones that did not have to happen.  I got angry because the research has shown since 2007 that Diabetes kills over 230,000 people every year and it's growing!  And yet it's buried on a fact sheet.
Diabetes is a public menace and must be beat.
It's time for WAR!
Declaration of War
Whereas Diabetes is a chronic disease in the United States that caused the death of 231,404 in 2007; that 18.8 million people are diagnosed with the disease, 7 million people with undiagnosed Diabetes, and 78 million people with Prediabetes;
And, whereas the total cost for Diabetes in the United States was estimated to be $218 Billion in 2007;
And, whereas in many cases Type 2 Diabetes can be controlled and managed once diagnosed;
And, whereas those who have Prediabetes do not have to get Diabetes - the condition can be reversed;
I am declaring war on Diabetes.  A take no prisoners approach to eradicating Diabetes in the US and the World.  To remove it from the list of 'chronic' diseases through education, encouragement, finding and scaling the best programs, and detecting and treating Prediabetes early.  To accomplish this I will use any tool that works to elevate public awareness and to treat the entire person so they thrive in their lives.
War On Diabetes Strategy
Every war needs a strategy, the War On Diabetes will:

Increase awareness of Diabetes and Prediabetes through placement of news articles on the Internet and through traditional media.
Promote the early detection of Prediabetes by making testing readily available by bringing the testing to where people are.
Educate the public on how choices they are making now effect them later.
Expose Diabetes for what it is - a deadly disease that can be controlled.
Find the best available programs and scale them for a region, a country and the world.
Create a place where those with Diabetes can find another with the disease.  It's a very lonely disease.
The war will not be won over-night, or in a year or two.  It's a generational war that must be fought and won.  Enlist in the War today.

Planning for War
The first step in the War is to become a recognized non-profit, which is why I am raising money.  Once that is accomplished, more funds and in-kind donations can be sought and accepted.  First, though, is getting recognized by the IRS and State.  The need breaks down this way:



IRS


$850




State

Contingency

Total


$2550

Is there a member of your family with Diabetes?  Do you have a friend with Diabetes?  Do you have Diabetes?  Help me begin to fight the war for the sake of our children and grand-children.  Without sounding overly dramatic, it's a War of our furtue.  
Unite with us Against Diabetes.

Two simple things: Exercise and Diet.  Exercise just 30 minutes a day and maintain a lower carb diet.  If you are overweight, lose a few pounds.  A loss of ten - 10 - pounds greatly reduces your chances of getting Diabetes.  Will you do that?  By not becoming a Diabetes statistic you are making a huge donation to the WAR and to your life.
Thank you for everything you will do.

story:
Hello everyone, Deuce Pesic here…

Thank you for viewing our video.  For those that are unaware, I began creating my designs when I fell in love with the Farnsworth House.  A mid-century modern home built by architect Ludwig Mies Van der Rohe in 1951.  A minimalist steel and glass structure that is simple yet elegant.  I was  overwhelmed by the cost of the higher end design styles that I learned to work with concrete and polymer resins to create my own backsplashes, countertops and vessel sinks in order to keep the costs down.  I anticipated retail sales of my design styles as each piece is handmade to match the exact desired colors through inlaying virtually anything, i.e. sands, stones, pebbles, silk flowers, metals even pictures.  When the housing market crashed, I continued to work with the materials but I scaled down to gift ideas and home accessories.  Feel free to view previous works at http://www.myspace.com/ndpesicgroup.  Someone mentioned how cool it would be if the dimensions were smaller and if it folded within itself, they could be sold to high end beach resorts around the globe as an oasis between the beach and resort itself, each tailored to perform its own function, a cocktail lounge, shower areas and cabanas.  As I was drawing the preliminary sketches, Hurricane Katrina devastated New Orleans.  This is when I realized that F.R.E.N.D.S. will initially be rolled out as a humanitarian product.

F.R.E.N.D.S. provide assistance in locations in 2 major ways.  Not only do they deliver aid to people in areas where aid is unavailable, but by providing the necessary environment for volunteers to do their jobs effectively, we hope it will bring more volunteers out.  These people who are willing to leave their families behind, to go to unknown areas and to help people they do not know, now have a facility to do their jobs and also have a temporary shelter as well.  We all have had a time in our lives where our friends helped us through our most difficult times.  I know…it has happened to me as well.  I have stated many times that I have the greatest friends in the world.  Always looking out to assure all is well and that our needs are met.  It was a coincidence, yet very fitting, that the acronym developed as it did.

What we need and what you get

$1.75 MM will get us quite a bit.  To elaborate from the video, we are planning to build 2 prototypes.  We are building both the 50’ unit as well as the 25’ F.R.E.N.D.S.  in order to show the stacking capabilities.  The solar package I stated in the video is for the 50’ structure alone so we will need an additional 16 solar panels and 4 batteries for the smaller units.  The 2 prototypes will cost approximately $400,000 to build.  The aluminum skeleton for the 50’ unit alone is $100,000 including labor (less tax).  So when we factor in the 2 units, then the facility being the highest expense as stated above, it’s a reasonable amount considering we also have electric and water, engineering fees, attorneys, accountant and operating costs such as travel, communications and payroll. A Public Relations firm would be needed to deliver the project to prospected buyers such as The Red Cross, FEMA, Homeland Security and our own U.S. Military.  The uses are vast and versatile. So the amount we request is pretty accurate.  Being that this amount is so close with not too much room for error, we hope we inspire enough people globally so as to receive more than the requested amount.  But it gets better…

I would feel uncomfortable being a repeat campaigner on indiegogo.  I feel other projects do need to set themselves up in stages to get the funding they need.  Because I am attempting to appear here only this time, we want to make you a promise….I pledge….that if we receive $5 MM in donations, we will utilize 20% of that amount (after fees) to fund our other project called “The Lint Project” !!  The Lint Project is an idea I have to acquire dryer lint in mass quantities, deliver to a central textile facility where it will be sanitized and manufactured into a renewable material.  It will be used to produce clothing to help clothe the homeless and those who lost everything in natural disasters.  The 20% will allow us to hire grant writers and maybe a lobbyist that will help us get government subsidies to perform a test state.  This test state would have our own bins in front of contracted grocery store chains to acquire the lint from homeowners, (we all have a lint bag next to our driers).  Drivers would pick up the bags of lint and transport them to a textile facility to manufacture the renewable material. 

It is very evident that your contributions would not only aid people in your own communities but on a global scale as well.  This is why our perks to you are unique.  For the majority of funding of $125 and under, a  t-shirt that will be designed by me, then we will make my polymer resin  creations…a large coaster (5 ½ inch bread plate size) and a plaque, puzzle piece design,  with a “Proud Supporter of F.R.E.N.D.S.” inlay that will be signed and numbered.  The plaque symbolizes a connection to the donor before you and after you, that you were a part of a larger picture…that without your piece, it would be incomplete.   I am also extending the $125 perk to every 250th consecutive donor of $20 and under (one per household) because their work and dedication on helping to spread the word is equally important as the ones donating higher amounts.

We will pay for domestic and international shipping on all perks.

Remember….

We hope to reach many people.  The only way to do it, is by spreading the word and encourage your recipients to do the same.  We would love to watch the project travel around the globe a few times. Because times are tight and we are doing the Public Relations ourselves, I have set the date to 55 days.  This way if bills are already paid this month, you can budget what you can for F.R.E.N.D.S. next month.

Spreading the word alone is just as important as the funds we are raising.  Getting the link passed around and in front of as many people as possible, can result in it, getting in front of the right individuals or organizations that can make a huge impact to this project.  So even if you cannot do it financially, do it socially.  You should feel proud that you contributed in saving many, many lives.

I want to thank you all in taking the time to view and read up on F.R.E.N.D.S.  We are One People, One Earth.  If we do not look out for each other, who will??

“…so that his place shall never be with those cold and timid souls who neither know victory nor defeat.” – Theodore Roosevelt , The Man in the Arena

story:
My name is Benita Elias, and about ten years ago my mother was diagnosed with cancer. She never liked to talk about it because she didn’t want my brother or I to worry about her, nevertheless we did everything we could to help. After a lot of work, and all this time later, her cancer is in complete remission! If she hadn’t done anything about it, the doctors said she would only have had ten years left.

This really puts into perspective how long we have on this earth. My mom and I always talk about the things we would like to do together, but the conversation usually ends with us saying “well, someday…”.

My mother has always wanted to travel, but she had us fairly young and dedicated all her time and energy to raising us by herself. Now that we are grown, she is sort of starting over and trying to figure out what she wants to do. I am a full time student with a two year old son, so between the two of us, we really don’t have the funds for vacations!

The one place she has always wanted to see here in the US is New York City. Instead of putting off a mother-daughter trip any longer, I would love to surprise her by taking her this year! This is where I need your help.

I have researched making this trip for months before I decided to go for it here. I have worked hard to find the best deals and be as frugal as possible. So, I am trying to raise $2800.00, which breaks down like this (I have rounded up to the nearest ten to account for taxes):

Round trip plane tickets for the both of us: $1,200

Hotel room for four nights: $850

Travel: Metro cards for the subway, $60 for two of us to have unlimited rides for the duration of the trip, plus $40 for a cab ride once we land to the hotel, totaling $100 for travel.

Food and contingencies: $500, this equals out to about $50 per person for food per day, and includes if we have any minor unexpected expenses

Platform fees: The additionall $150 accounts for the funding fees

If I do not make the goal at all, I will donate the entirety of the money to the clinic that helped my mom overcome cancer. We didn’t have health insurance and it is because of small clinics like this that helped save my mom.

The same goes for if this raises more than my goal, any additional money will be donated to the clinic.

I understand that there are so many worthwhile causes out there to donate to, through this project you can make at least one person’s dream a reality! This is valuable to me because I have always wanted to do something like this for my mom but have never been able to afford it. It is a possibility that I might never have been able to take her on a trip and it would have just been a dream. I can just imagine how happy this would make her, and how wonderful it would be to know that there are people out there generous enough to make this happen.

If you are not able to make a monetary contribution, just spreading the word helps greatly and it is much appreciated!!!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this!

 

I would like to add that I have not included my mother’s name on purpose for her privacy. Should you have any questions however, I am more than happy to answer them!

story: As most of you know, I have been sick for a while now.  All of a sudden my health plummeted further down.  I've spent almost every day for the past couple weeks at Kaiser (My Health Insurance Provider) either seeing my General practitioner, endocrinologist, neurologists, Geneticists, Pain Managements Doctors, lab work, MRI's, ECG's. CATS, classes for pain management. You name it. My Co-pays are still astronomical for me at this time, because I am unable to work. I have documents for all of these if anyone would like to see them.  I had someone ask me why my copay's are so high. Well, that's the plan I have and how much things cost.  My Plan is $340 dollars a month alone.Impatient surgury per day is $600 alone. I set the goal low because I figure everyone is hurting for money right now. To cover my bills itll cost around $1200.00.  Kaiser Gold Plan for Individuals, age 32. My MRI's and other large tests have a $250 dollar copay, my GP has a $30 dollar copay, my specialists have a $50 dollar copay, my labs have a $30 dollar copay, my medication varies, Pain management classes are $30 dollars a class with a doctor to help me deal with the horrific pain without having to take narcotic medications. All of these things, plus my other living expenses have run me dry.  I don't like asking for help at all. Its just not me. I was told by my adviser.. from my friend Bill W,, that I needed to humble myself and just do it. So that's what I'm doing. If anyone can possibly help, Id be forever grateful. Special thanks to one amazing angel that has helped me. Georgia Th. I feel so blessed with such a good person, it makes me cry just thinking about her. I cant thank her enough. She helped pay for one of my MRI's. I'm forever grateful.  Special thanks to Debbie McEntire for coming to my house and calling and calling until I've answered to check on me. She's also spent a lot of time just picking me up and going for a drive and talking and letting me know things will be ok, and helping to pull me out of the hole of loneliness and fright, and giving me the wonderful blessing of laughter and knowing that she really cares. I please ask my God and whomever has taken their time out to read this to help me in any way. There's no such thing as too little. Anything will help me at this point. I am very scared at this point. I do have a good team at Kaiser thats working with me. Im waiting for my disability to kick in. It is taking forever! Even with an emergency rush thats on it. One of my parents is retired and the other will be in a few months. My dad is telling me that Im going to have to figure it out on my own because they need to make sure they have money for their retirement to live. It hurt when he told me this, but I know its true. I do not have wealthy parents.  Thanks for taking your time to read this. Keep me in your prayers also please. I really need those right now. If anyone would like to see documents etc, please feel free to ask. Ill gladly provide them for you. Love and blessings to all. Thanks to all. Love Jeff 909 210 3647

story:
My name is Jason Mullins and I am currently enrolled as a Bachelors of Science in nursing student at the Denver School of Nursing in Denver, Colorado. I am also an EMT and an avid outdoor enthusiast with a passion for mixing health and travel. As a student I participate in Global Health Perspectives, a student organization dedicated to understanding issues related to health and disease throughout the world. In June of this year (2014) I have the honor of traveling to the Yumbe District of the West Nile Region of Uganda on a mission to combine healthcare and nutrition. I will be one of a 7 person team, comprised of 4 Denver School of Nursing students, and 3 members of The Mango Project. We will be working in tandem with Mango Project founder Micah Hughes to deliver nutrition and nutrition education, health care and health education (especially malaria awareness and prevention), and enhance local access to safe drinking water. The Mango Project has conducted nutrition based interventions in the area since 2003 with the mission of decreasing malnutrition in the region through sustainable use of local resources and knowledge coupled with food preservation techniques used for decades here in the United States. Our task is to conduct health screenings, assist local medical personnel, share knowledge and education about health, and collect statistical data to help conduct a longitudinal study on the effects of increased nutrition on the local population. We will also educate locals on malaria prevention and treatment (as well as other health issues), and assist locals in obtaining some basic water filtration equipment.


Your contribution will help send me there and assist with airfare, transportation once in country, obtain medical supplies and water filtration equipment, and hire a translator. All funds raised will go toward the trip and supplies; any extra funds will also go toward medical, anti-malarial, and water filtration supplies. Every dollar is a huge help and resources can go a long way in this region! The goal is to empower locals and utilize local resources and resourcefulness to achieve a long term sustainable, local driven nutrition and health intervention. We share our knowledge with the local community and assist them in achieving the goals of increased nutrition and health. Your help greatly increases our capacity to make a difference.

Unfortunately at this time I have no perks to offer, except that I will represent your spirit of compassion and generosity in Yumbe to the best of my capability. It is with sincere gratitude that  I accept any donations to this mission, however much it may be! Thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign, and please spread the word around if you could.
