$70 Player Jersey from the Crimson Elite or Crimson Fliers! Choose a specific player on either of the teams and we'll send you a jersey identical to the jerseys we wear on the pitch.

$80 Custom Jersey with a name and number of your choice! These may be in the style of either Utah Quidditch team. 

If you can't donate, help us out by sharing this campaign with anyone you think might be interested. 


    What This Means To Us Money raised through this campaign will go directly towards the funding of travel and housing for Crimson Elite players and coaches. In the event there is money left over we will reinvest it directly back into the Utah Quidditch program to help fund future UTQ hosted tournaments such as Crimson Cup and the ever-popular Snow Cup. Utah Quidditch is a grassroots organization and no individual benefits directly from the money made from this fundraiser. 
The amount of time put in by all members of Utah Quidditch on top of our other responsibilities is often staggering, but our love for this nutty sport trumps any stress it may cause. 
Every little bit helps. Thank you for helping us fund our passion. 

*We will email you about the specifics of your perks after the campaign ends in order to make sure everything is as you desire.

story:
If you have tried using towels at the gym, you have probably felt our frustration. They are unsanitary, uncomfortable, and aren’t designed to protect you from germs. Many are not designed to absorb sweat, they are tough on your body, and are generally made as a cheap accessory.

That's Why We Designed The T-Wipe!

Training Wipe fitness towels offer a trendy hands-free design with a padded strap that fastens at the neck and waist. The strap allows user to utilize T-Wipe towel without having to worry about dropping the towel and losing momentum along the fitness course. Inc., no endorsement implied.

 

T-Wipe towels are softer and more absorbent than the average terry cotton towel, absorbing sweat seven times their weight.

 

iPod and mp3 compatible

Further optimizing the user’s performance, T-Wipe fitness towels also include a convenient dock for iPod Nano and MP3 players. It includes a Safety Hook for accompanying earphone cords. By offering music in a convenient location, individuals can use rhythm to increase the intensity and speed at which they perform.

With its unique cooling system, Training Wipe fitness towels will boost your performance when exercising outdoors and indoors reducing your risk of heat exhaustion. 

We didn’t stop there... The cooling system compartment can also be used to store items that are commonly lost while exercising like: I.D.s, keys and credit cards. This convenient feature reduces the risk of theft and frustration due to loss.

T-Wipe is made from 100% organic bamboo yarn which is naturally hypo-allergenic, antibacterial, odor and mold resistant, making it an ideal material for the body. 

Bamboo yarns are completely biodegradable at the end of their useful life, the cellulose fibers naturally decompose when exposed to sunlight. T-Wipe is earth-friendly, it can actually be composted and disintegrate completely into the earth. T-Wipe is also environmentally friendly because Bamboo towels are completely biodegradable.

PARTNER T-SHIRTS

We designed T-Wipe to reduce your risk of infection and to compliment an active lifestyle.

We’ve been working on Training Wipe Fitness Towel for over one year now. The T-Wipe that you see in the video is a real working prototype and has been tried and tested.

With your support, we can bring T-Wipe to you and help reduce your daily risk of infections at the gym and boost your athletic performance. Your contribution will help fund production.

Please share with any friends that like well-made products or own a Nano/Shuffle iPod.

Note: iPod Nano is a registered trademark of Apple Inc., no endorsement implied.


Q&A:

Q: Is the T-wipe made in different colors?

A: Yes, there are multiple T-wipe colors. White, black, red, orange, olive, turquois, lime, green, blue and pink.

Q: Can the T-wipe substitute the ordinary towel I normally use to workout with?

A: Absolutely! The T-wipe promotes sanitation while getting your sweat on!

Q: How easy is it to apply the T-wipe strap?

A: Easy to strap on and off. Simply wrap around your body and attach!

Q: How do I use the "cooling system" on the T-wipe?

A: The cooling system is a designated area for ice or a gel pack. Insert the ice or ice pack in the pocket to keep from overheating during your workout.

Q: What music devices can I connect to the T-wipe?

A: iPod Nano, iPod Shuffle, and most mp3 players fit the music device dock.

Q: Does the placement of the mp3 player on the T-wipe make the pedometer App more accurate?

A: Yes, because the app works with your heart rate, the placement of your mp3 player on the T-wipe makes pedometer App calculations more accurate.

story:
Help us give ALL kids a place to enjoy gymnastics and sports!

Tumbling to a better tomorrow!

Thank you for joining us on this adventure, and please enjoy our story that is full of flips, fun, and friendship. Our athletes hold a meaningful place in our hearts, and we hope that we can show the world just how special they are.


Balance 180 Brags

Balance 180 highlighted in collection of great special needs groups and activities

Balance 180 is so grateful and honored to have been selected as a tops special needs activity by PhDinSpecialEducation.com! The full list of all 101 special needs activities can be found here. Be sure to check out #46! 

Fall 2013 Culminating Event another success!

Balance 180 had another great Culminating Event for the Fall 2013 session of one of our programs for children with special needs. We are appreciative for our GTN News feature by Briana Harper, following the event. Check out the story and video here!

Athletes featured in article in Home magazine

Be sure to check out pages 118-121 in Home: Living in the Heart of Florida magazine's December 2013/January 2014 for a great article by Chris Eversole on Balance 180.


What is Balance 180?

Balance 180 is a non-profit organization in Gainesville, Florida. Our mission is to develop a new model for recreational and competitive sports within our community that serves children and young people with varying abilities and needs. Our goal is to give all children an opportunity to participate in sports, while encouraging them to learn and grow to realize their unique potential. We strive to serve the whole child, recognizing that kids benefit from lots of encouragement, a positive environment and opportunities to succeed. 

How did it all begin?

“Is there a place where children who are less coordinated or that have a disability can enjoy gymnastics and benefit from the physical activity?” That was co-founders Krista Vandenborne’s and Carsten Schmalfuss’ question. As health care professionals with daughters who participated in competitive gymnastics, they recognized something was missing and were determined to do something about it. In their view, children needed a place where they could receive the support to excel and enjoy sports, regardless of their ability. From this need came Balance 180, a place where children can learn gymnastics skills, make new friends, and feel a sense of belonging. With a generous community and a large number of students and health professionals, Gainesville, Florida has allowed us to create a unique program that benefits children with varying abilities. 

What happens at Balance 180 and what has been accomplished in the first year?

Balance 180 is an exciting place, which offers both recreational and adaptive gymnastics classes for kids ages 2 to 14 years old. Each class is staffed with positive, energetic coaches and volunteers that can provide assistance where needed. The kids learn forward rolls, handstands, cartwheels, pullovers on bars, and many more traditional gymnastics skills. In just over one year, we have grown from serving 14 athletes to almost 150. This growth indicates that the need for a program like Balance 180 exists. One appreciative parent commented: "These classes are an amazing asset to the special needs community."  

This past summer we also offered the first inclusive gymnastics camp in Alachua County, integrating children with and without disabilities. The camp was a tremendous success and we all had lots of fun. Gymnastics classes were supplemented with art projects, dancing and games. All of the kids exercised and played together, and warming-up and stretching quickly became a group activity they looked forward to. And of course there was snack-time, a time for everybody to relax and share stories. For many of our athletes this was their first camp EVER, and what an experience it was! One of the parents of a young boy with Down Syndrome sent us a grateful email after camp which read: “I am so excited that my son had an active 3 weeks that kept him exercising.”  

Who are all of our wonderful volunteers?

One cannot think of Balance 180 without reflecting on the dedication of our amazing volunteers. Our volunteer base ranges from 100 to 120 volunteers each semester, and they have cumulatively logged over 5,000 hours of service. Most of the volunteers are students committed to a career in education or health care and they appreciate the experience of working with our young athletes. We are proud of the training we provide to our volunteers and hope they take the lessons and memories into their future endeavors. All of our volunteers are wonderful young people focused on creating a positive environment to support our athletes and help them thrive, independent of their ability. 


What is the adaptive gymnastics class and how is it different?

In the adaptive gymnastics classes, the curriculum and lesson plans are adapted to each child’s specific needs. The athletes learn skills on vault, bars, beam, and floor with the assistance of one or two dedicated volunteers. The focus is on ensuring the athletes can be successful in each of the activities. The gym often gets filled with a lot of cheering and encouragement. A parent recently commented that for her child, “Coming to the gym for one hour makes her entire week.” Our goal is to ensure each child realizes they are special, that we care, and that together with us they can always learn new skills. Our athletes and volunteers laugh, play, exercise, and have fun together each week. 

What are the benefits of gymnastics?

Physical education programs can significantly improve the lifestyle of a child with disabilities. In addition to guarding against obesity and promoting an active lifestyle, physical activity improves a child's motivation and self-image. Sports like gymnastics help a child build important motor skills, core strength, balance and coordination, but it is also a wonderful way to learn how to follow directions, focus, and build social skills. The athletes learn from our coaches and volunteers, but they learn even more from interacting with their peers.

The less tangible benefits from our program include the sense of accomplishment each child experiences when they learn something new. At the end of each class, the athletes are rewarded with star stickers on a chart that tracks their mastery of new skills, which can range from somersaults to walking on a balance beam. The gym is always full of positive energy with cheers, hugs, and high fives. Our goal is to make sure that each child knows that we care!

Where do we see ourselves in the future?

Today we serve about 150 kids in the Gainesville community, about 60 of which have special needs. This is a small portion of the kids that could eventually benefit from our programs. Through our fundraising efforts, we hope to accommodate many more kids and provide additional scholarships for athletes who need financial assistance. We hope to expand and advance our classes, and offer summer camp to a larger group of kids.

Balance 180, its coaches, and volunteers have a lot of heart, passion, and expertise; however, there is SO MUCH MORE we can accomplish with your support! Our vision is to offer our services five days a week and have kids exercise side by side, independent of their ability, cheering each other on when they learn and accomplish new skills. ALL kids need to feel empowered with a sense of success and accomplishment, and enjoy the opportunity to create lasting friendships.   

What can you do to help?

Balance 180 does not receive any federal or state support, so we are highly dependent on the generosity of individual donations and corporate sponsorships. As part of this campaign, our goal is to raise at least $15,000, which will go towards covering some of our expenses such as:

  • Athlete scholarships
  • Rental of our practice facility
  • Fans to keep the gym cool...We don't have AC and Florida gets HOT!
  • Equipment: Safety mats, high beams, bars, etc.
  • Apparel: shorts, t-shirts, and leotards
  • Transportation to field trips during summer camp
  • Intern and coach stipends 
  • Materials to raise community awareness
  • Training of volunteers and interns

Scholarships are our top priority to ensure that no child is left out due to financial restraints. Our low monthly tuition cost can still be too expensive for some families as many are dealing with significant medical expenses.


Your contribution is not just a donation, it is an investment in the future of our children and our community. No matter how small or how large the gift, your generosity will have a tremendous impact on the life of a child. Please join us in making a difference!

Please note: When you donate, your receipt will say "Jordan Klausner Foundation". The Jordan Klausner Foundation, a registered 501(c)(3) organization, is the fiscal sponsor of Balance 180 Gymnastics & Sports Academy, a non-profit corporation in the State of Florida. Donations to Balance 180 Gymnastics & Sports Academy via the Jordan Klausner Foundation are tax-deductible.

How else can you help?

While your donation is certainly appreciated to help us grow and run our programs, there is another way you can have an impact. Please help us share our story and campaign with your friends, families, and coworkers and direct them to this Indiegogo Campaign. Also, please share our video to help us get the word out about our incredible athletes. Sharing our story will increase our chances of reaching our goal and offering our program to the kids who need it the most.  

Finally, be sure to follow us on Twitter and like us on Facebook for updates on our athletes and our progress towards our fundraising goal! Thank YOU for making a difference, and supporting Balance 180 and our athletes.

story:
Origins of LifeZoop

Human brain is still a mystery and many scientists have been studying how it works to store the memory of our life. However, our brain would only select the most exciting memory to store into our brain. Not all our experience can be stored there.

Since our memory can not tell us everything in life,have you ever wondered the path of your life? Will you be interested in knowing your special experience in certain day? We believe people would be very interested in every move in their life, specially when he or she is getting older. LifeZoop is thus developed in assisting people to document their own life with videos and to capture mutual memory by mashing up videos. 

LifeZoop is made up of two words: Life and Zoopraxiscope. The zoopraxiscope is an early device for displaying motion pictures. Created by photographic pioneer Eadweard Muybridge in 1879, it may be considered the first movie projector. LifeZoop takes "zoopraxiscope" as part of its name expecting itself becomes the pioneer of video social App.   


                             



Features and Functions

There are three primary features in LifeZoop:

  • Video Capture : LifeZoop provides you handy video capture functions with great picture quality of 480P/640P. User could shoot the videos in intervals to capture impressed moments as many as one can. 

             


  • View and Explore : User can search videos by Tags (Time, Locations, Keywords, Mood score) to explore the videos they are interested in. Unlike the general social medias, LifeZoop helps you more to face the inner and real me.

            


  • Mash Up : Mash-up enables users to mix your videos on that day with your freinds and families. Since the video time of LifeZoop is 6 seconds,more memorable moments can be strung up together to become mutual memory.

            


Functions & System Diagram :

            




Benefits of LifeZoop

  • No regrets when you look back to life years after
  • Enrich colors of your life
  • Expand your life span 
  • Mashing up your memory together with your families' and friends' 
  • String up people in this global village



Meet our Team


Larry is a mid-aged adventurer. He established weitei inc. (www.weitei.com) simply because he likes to do something interesting and meaningful before it is too late. From hardware to software, Larry is still fighting for his belief and will never give it up. 

Andrew is Larry's superior during their services in IT industry. Andrew could have been enjoying his retirement if Larry is not bothering him for help from time to time. Andrew is now managing the integration of User Interface and Software Engineering of the LifeZoop project.  

Alex is an energetic young man (compared with Larry and Andrew). Larry gets acquainted with Alex in Larry's early projects. Owing to thorough observation and understanding about human nature, Alex is a very good sales person in this team. Alex is now supervising marketing and user behavior in the LifeZoop project.  

Unlike some of the most prestigious genius in the world, we are just ordinary people like the most of us. We often argued for what should be built in the App but we never turn our backs to each other. We sometimes made mistakes for what has been done but we never regret to make the decision. We might occasionally lose the direction but we shall walk out of the mist hand in hand. We like each other and we like this team very much. Our goal is to build a sexy team which is smart, thoughtful and considerate.



Current Status

LifeZoop project was kicked off in Jul , 2013 and its initial capital is financed by team crews. The App is expected to launch for download in Apps markets in Oct this year. 85~90% of the 1st stage tasks have been done now and our software programmers are being busy in the rest tasks and user experience test as well. We are very confident that LifeZoop App of iOS will be available in timely manner. 



Time Lines of LifeZoop

Yet to make the LifeZoop App powerful and popular, there are still a lot to be done in the future. These jobs include :

  • Android Version
  • Perfection of User Interface
  • Advertisement Platform
  • Improvement of Backbone efficiency 



Why we need your support

As you can tell from the above tasks on the timeline, there are many big jobs to be carried on after the Launch of LifeZoop App for iOS. We shall immediately proceed to the developments of Android version and some new features for the 2nd stage. These new features and improvements are aiming to enhance and improve the user experience which we are not capable in the 1st stage of development.  

LifeZoop project was kicked off in Jul , 2013 and its initial capital is financed by team crews. The App is expected to launch for download in Apps markets in Oct this year. 85~90% of the 1st stage tasks have been done now and our software programmers are being busy in the rest tasks and user experience test as well. We are confident that LifeZoop App of iOS will be available in timely manner.

Yet to make the LifeZoop App powerful and popular, there are still a lot to be done in the future. These tasks are very important to complete the functions and perfect the user experience of LifeZoop. Please help us to finish the last mile of this App. 

Here is the breakdown of what we need from you : 

  • 2nd stage of iOS version : $4,000 
  • Android Version : $15,000
  • Perfection of User Interface : $9,000
  • Advertisement Platform : $11,000
  • Improvement of Backbone efficiency : $5,000



The charms in return 

LifeZoop is is not a hardware, therefore, it cannot be acquired at discounted prices. LifeZoop is an App for free download as we like more people can take this App to record their wonderful lives.  

We have been thinking what perks would be useful to the potential contributors to LifeZoop project. Suddenly, we found our traditional "charms" could represent our appreciation to our contributors. The charm is made of wood and painted in red. Each charm has special meaning in Mandarin. You can find the respective translation in English under each charm in the following figure. The charms represent our sincere bless from bottom of our hearts and we wish you like it.



We also believe good thing would be better done by more people.  It is preferable that more people support us each with smaller amount of money instead of less people with bigger amount. We really wish more people could receive the charms. The charms is handy and can be used in many ways in life. Check this out ! 




Infinite Thanks 

At last, we really appreciate your time and patience for reading this message through. We wish you a better life no matter you will support us or not. 


Furthermore, at this moment, let's bless all Syrian innocent people staying alive and free from persecution and war.
story_txt:
Origins of LifeZoop

Human brain is still a mystery and many scientists have been studying how it works to store the memory of our life. However, our brain would only select the most exciting memory to store into our brain. Not all our experience can be stored there.
Since our memory can not tell us everything in life,have you ever wondered the path of your life? Will you be interested in knowing your special experience in certain day? We believe people would be very interested in every move in their life, specially when he or she is getting older. LifeZoop is thus developed in assisting people to document their own life with videos and to capture mutual memory by mashing up videos. 
LifeZoop is made up of two words: Life and Zoopraxiscope. The zoopraxiscope is an early device for displaying motion pictures. Created by photographic pioneer Eadweard Muybridge in 1879, it may be considered the first movie projector. LifeZoop takes "zoopraxiscope" as part of its name expecting itself becomes the pioneer of video social App.   


                              


Features and Functions
There are three primary features in LifeZoop:


Video Capture : LifeZoop provides you handy video capture functions with great picture quality of 480P/640P. User could shoot the videos in intervals to capture impressed moments as many as one can. 


             




View and Explore : User can search videos by Tags (Time, Locations, Keywords, Mood score) to explore the videos they are interested in. Unlike the general social medias, LifeZoop helps you more to face the inner and real me.


            




Mash Up : Mash-up enables users to mix your videos on that day with your freinds and families. Since the video time of LifeZoop is 6 seconds,more memorable moments can be strung up together to become mutual memory.

            
Functions & System Diagram :


            




Benefits of LifeZoop

No regrets when you look back to life years after
Enrich colors of your life
Expand your life span 
Mashing up your memory together with your families' and friends' 
String up people in this global village





Meet our Team






Larry is a mid-aged adventurer. He established weitei inc. (www.weitei.com) simply because he likes to do something interesting and meaningful before it is too late. From hardware to software, Larry is still fighting for his belief and will never give it up. 
Andrew is Larry's superior during their services in IT industry. Andrew could have been enjoying his retirement if Larry is not bothering him for help from time to time. Andrew is now managing the integration of User Interface and Software Engineering of the LifeZoop project.  
Alex is an energetic young man (compared with Larry and Andrew). Larry gets acquainted with Alex in Larry's early projects. Owing to thorough observation and understanding about human nature, Alex is a very good sales person in this team. Alex is now supervising marketing and user behavior in the LifeZoop project.  
Unlike some of the most prestigious genius in the world, we are just ordinary people like the most of us. We often argued for what should be built in the App but we never turn our backs to each other. We sometimes made mistakes for what has been done but we never regret to make the decision. We might occasionally lose the direction but we shall walk out of the mist hand in hand. We like each other and we like this team very much. Our goal is to build a sexy team which is smart, thoughtful and considerate.






Current Status
LifeZoop project was kicked off in Jul , 2013 and its initial capital is financed by team crews. The App is expected to launch for download in Apps markets in Oct this year. 85~90% of the 1st stage tasks have been done now and our software programmers are being busy in the rest tasks and user experience test as well. We are very confident that LifeZoop App of iOS will be available in timely manner. 





Time Lines of LifeZoop
Yet to make the LifeZoop App powerful and popular, there are still a lot to be done in the future. These jobs include :


Android Version
Perfection of User Interface
Advertisement Platform
Improvement of Backbone efficiency 



Why we need your support
As you can tell from the above tasks on the timeline, there are many big jobs to be carried on after the Launch of LifeZoop App for iOS. We shall immediately proceed to the developments of Android version and some new features for the 2nd stage. These new features and improvements are aiming to enhance and improve the user experience which we are not capable in the 1st stage of development.  
LifeZoop project was kicked off in Jul , 2013 and its initial capital is financed by team crews. The App is expected to launch for download in Apps markets in Oct this year. 85~90% of the 1st stage tasks have been done now and our software programmers are being busy in the rest tasks and user experience test as well. We are confident that LifeZoop App of iOS will be available in timely manner.

Yet to make the LifeZoop App powerful and popular, there are still a lot to be done in the future. These tasks are very important to complete the functions and perfect the user experience of LifeZoop. Please help us to finish the last mile of this App. 
Here is the breakdown of what we need from you : 


2nd stage of iOS version : $4,000 
Android Version : $15,000
Perfection of User Interface : $9,000
Advertisement Platform : $11,000
Improvement of Backbone efficiency : $5,000







The charms in return 


LifeZoop is is not a hardware, therefore, it cannot be acquired at discounted prices. LifeZoop is an App for free download as we like more people can take this App to record their wonderful lives.  

We have been thinking what perks would be useful to the potential contributors to LifeZoop project. Suddenly, we found our traditional "charms" could represent our appreciation to our contributors. The charm is made of wood and painted in red. Each charm has special meaning in Mandarin. You can find the respective translation in English under each charm in the following figure. The charms represent our sincere bless from bottom of our hearts and we wish you like it.





We also believe good thing would be better done by more people.  It is preferable that more people support us each with smaller amount of money instead of less people with bigger amount. We really wish more people could receive the charms. The charms is handy and can be used in many ways in life. Check this out ! 










Infinite Thanks At last, we really appreciate your time and patience for reading this message through. We wish you a better life no matter you will support us or not. 
Furthermore, at this moment, let's bless all Syrian innocent people staying alive and free from persecution and war.

story:
I will keep it very simple...

My good friend Udone, who lives in Laos, needs to have dental surgery to relieve him of a painful condition.  I have known Udone since 2007, and the picture you see if of he and I from that time.  Udone and I have a wonderful relationship.  He gives me wisdom, and I, in exchange, support him from time to time.


Coming from a rather impoverished background, Udone has nevertheless lifted himself up into a more stable life.  But at times like this, we need your help.  While in the past I may have been able to help him financially on my own, this time I am unemployed, so I need your help!


A small donation, even 1 dollar, would help so much.  I will get the funds together and 100%, ALL of the money, will be donated to the cost of his medical procedures, travel, and recovery.  We are not asking for much.  Just 500 USD can help Udone recover from his illness...


Think about it, don't you spend 5 dollars a day on coffee alone?  Skip that latte and send Udone 5 dollars.  I'll make sure he gets it, ASAP.


It's easy, it's direct, it's what is right...


Thank you

story:
My name is Kerri Thoelen. I am 35 years old. I have been married for almost 12  yrs now and I have 3 beautiful children. We have an 8 yr old son, an almost 7 yr old daughter and an almost 5 yr old son. On Dec 1,2010 I was diagnosed with Breast Cancer. I began chemo just before Christmas and ended in March. I had a mastectomy in April 2011 and then went through radiation that summer. After my surgery they discovered that I was now HER2 + which basically means I had to go through a year long infusion treatment (every 3 weeks). I will continue with that treatment into July of this year. Just before Christmas last year I had a hysterectomy as a precaution to prevent ovarian cancer, which is strongly related to breast cancer. Next month I will be having what I hope is my last surgery. I will be having a 2nd mastectomy and reconstruction.
Through all of this my husband has been an amazing support and working like crazy to try to keep up with all of the bills. As it stands right now we are really struggling to pay our bills.
Due to all of my doctors appointments, there is the extra cost of transportation and food when I am unable to cook for the family.
Anything donated through this site will go directly to pay off medical bills or related expenses for my care.
 
Thank you for your support. May God bless you always.
 
You can read my whole story at http://hewillcarrymethrough.blogspot.com

story:
I want to help the mexican shaman ANA Teresa Sanchez Gonzalez to help to realize her Mission of awake peoples wisdom of their hearts to create a better world in balance, peace and harmony for us and our children.

Ana and her work is so beautiful, almost undescribable. With her wisdom and work my life changed from black to white.

As i am a student, i dont have much money and need your help. I bought a flight that costs 1.400 Euro, the car that we will travel around with, is a really old boroughed camper that needs around 700 Euro to get repaired and we need fuel for driving from Germany to Spain. This are the biggest efforts we have to make money for.

 ANA WILL ALREADY ARRIVE AT THE 21 of JUNE !!!

 

The Core Persons that try to realize Anas Mission are:

Ana Teresa Sanchez Gonzalez:

http://www.bluejay.eu/schamanen/ana-teresa-s-gonzalez/

http://www.facebook.com/AnaTeresaInEuropa

story:
SJOBA is one of the most reputable alumni societies in India and engages in several humanitarian and philanthropic events.  Recently, SJOBA lost a precious member of its 1978 batch, Sandeep Bangia.  In order to honour Sandeep's memory, SJOBA will team up with Rotary Blood Bank Society Chandigarh for a blood drive.


Please express your kindness and generocity by donating towards this event.

story:
Hello!

About Me:

I am a 45 year old single mom, coordinator for Seattle Hempfest for 18 years, Burning Man commmunity member, gardner and "virtuoso cook."  I currently work for a fabulous non-profit that is doing much to truly help save the planet.  I also cater on the side and was once paid to feed Ralph Nader during his presidential campaign in 2000.  I have been a professional artist most of my life - floral designer, seamstress, milliner, chef and goldsmith.   I have bake and sculpted wedding and birthday cakes since I was 20. 

With all these capabilities and capacities, I also have a very hard time asking for help. I like being seen as capable of managing whatever life throws at me.


My Condition:

This spring, I was in the hospital fighting for my life due to double pulmonary embolisms.  I was told I'm very lucky to be alive.  The doctors determined it was an idiosyncratic onset. I am still recovering from this and must still go to the doctor each week. I have been living on the financial edge for a while but additional expenses have created a situation where the gap keeps widening and becoming homeless is immanent.

My Need:

I need to raise $6,000 to cover the gap that my emergency hospitalization created.  I do my best to live very frugally and light on the earth and believe firmly that being a good and happy person will take me where I need to go. 

Sadly, karma does not pay the bills.  That's why I am looking to you for some help.  I have been told I have paid it forward for years and it's okay to reach out to save myself.

Thank you so much for your time and consideration.

story:
(Note to contributors, the prints and coffee table book will be "uncensored" when they arrive)

What is this about?

October is National Breast Cancer Awareness month, and to help increase awareness about this horrible disease, Live 105.3's Megan Holiday has teamed up with Steve Gatlin to create a special photo series and short documentary for his Beauty Project.

The Beauty Project is a series of photographs created at night, in public settings incorporating light, motion and the human form.

From October 1st until Midnight on the 31st, this very special crowd-funding campaign will run so friends, families and fans can pledge money towards the breast cancer awareness efforts of the “Keep a Breast Foundation.” Incentives for pledging will include personalized copies of Megan’s Beauty Project images.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have decided to set a goal of $5,000 for this campaign. We understand that times are tough but feel that by providing awesome incentives at reasonable pledge amounts we can get there.

And of course, we would LOVE to go far beyond our goal, so spread the word and keep pledging.

Check the column on the right to see the really cool incentives we have created. They start at $10 for a special Twitter shout-out, to a commemorative postcard signed by Megan and Steve, prints of Megan's images from the Beauty Project collection, a coffee table book and more!

- Some of the Beauty Project images were created with a special 3D camera and any of those incentives will also come with 3D glasses for viewing.

- 100% of the net from each pledge will go directly to the “Keep a Breast Foundation.”

The Impact

According to Breast Cancer Society, Inc., Women and men diagnosed with stage 0 breast cancer have a 100 percent chance of survival after treatment. Those diagnosed with stage II have a 98 percent chance; virtually everyone survives this stage for at least five years. After stage II, survival rates drop quickly.

THIS IS WHY EARLY DETECTION AND AWARENESS IS SO IMPORTANT!

Megan and Steve feel that this project is perfectly paired with the "Keep a Breast Foundation" because of their dedication to early detection and awareness through art and music.

Do you want to give a shoot a try?

As an additional way to raise money for breast cancer awareness, we have decided to donate 20% of every shoot booked through this page to the "Keep a Breast Foundation." Click the "Buy Now" button below to purchase your shoot. You will then be contacted by Steve Gatlin to setup a night that fits your schedule. This is the perfect way to experience what Megan and 100's of other people have and also help this incredible cause!

If you think you are ready for your Beauty Project shoot, but have additional questions, you can EMAIL STEVE HERE. The purchase price of this shoot is good for anywhere in the San Francisco Bay Area where Live 105.3 can be heard by radio signal. If you have found this page by way of online stream and are outside of the San Francisco Bay Area CONTACT STEVE to arrange a price package to get your photos taken.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

Whether you have made or pledge or just cannot for financial reasons, please spread the word about this important campaign!

Forward this link to everyone you know: http://www.indiegogo.com/flashesofbeauty

Click here to see a special "thank you" video from Megan

Click the image below to learn more about the Beauty Project

Thank you for your support!

Megan and Steve

story:
Healthy Girls Save the World (HGSW) is a program catered towards promoting healthy bodies, healthy minds, and healthy relationships for girls aged 8-15 in North Carolina. HGSW is in partnership with UNC- Chapel Hill’s APPLES Service Learning Program.  

Over the past three decades, childhood obesity rates in America have tripled. Today, almost one in every three children in our nation is overweight or obese. In North Carolina, the numbers are more alarming than the national average. Childhood obesity is an epidemic in this state. Healthy Girls Save the World provides a proposed solution to this problem.

HGSW is an organization that provides the tools and knowledge for young girls to create and sustain a healthy and well-rounded lifestyle. The core of HGSW is to educate girls on the importance of healthy eating habits, regular exercise and chronic obesity related illness prevention. This program also integrates lessons on self-esteem, good study habits, and the importance of respectful and positive relationships. Healthy Girls Save the World acts as a base to launch the potential of girls to help them realize all that they are capable of physically and mentally. HGSW aspires to serve, build, and develop girls into powerful women that will save the world!

story:
Haydee 23, the daughter of my friend Rebecca, was a normal, healthy girl until March 2013 and is now very seriously ill in the Philippines with kidney failure (end stage) and complications which may result in a leg amputation. Haydee, is married and has a two year old son Vince. Rebecca and her husband have been working in England with all their wages being sent to their daughter to pay for dialysis 3 times a week and hospitalization bills due to complications arise. Haydee has been told that she needs a transplant urgently.

Rebecca never buys clothes or anything except for vital things.

Haydee's dialysis and related expenses costs £250 a week. The government have paid for 45 sessions but fares and other medication expenses (3,000 pesos/week) still have to be paid. Every ten sessions they have to pay for a new dialyser 1,680 Pesos.  The Operation Estimated Total: PHP 1,775,950.00( GBP £ 23,806) and approx. 150,000 pesos for the donor matching.(GBP 1 = PHP 74.60) Exact amounts are difficult to give as they change at times.We have chosen to use the money even if it does not reach our goal as it will still be a start in saving towards it.

Haydee is now a chair bound and her husband is unable to get a job because he needs to look after Haydee all the time and at the same time looking after their son. So their everyday living expenses rely on Rebecca and her husband's remittance to sustain Haydee's hospitalisations, dialysis, laboratories.etc.. Rebecca and her husband's is not able to save for her transplant as the cost of transplant is too overwhelming for her and her husband.

HOW IS HAYDEE NOW?

Haydee can no longer able to live a normal life due to her left leg recent operation due to blood clot accumulated in her left leg and left hand that affected her mobility., she's now a chair bound and treatment is on going.

Anything that you can do or give would be most appreciated. Even though we may all be struggling with our expenses, maybe you could just give the smallest amount towards our goal. It's a great many help in even a very small way, we can get there. Please pass on this request to all your contacts, that is a great way to help.

Very many thanks for even taking the time to read this request. I don't know anything that I can do in return other than thank you from the bottom of my heart. Any questions you have may be sent to Rebecca at reb.ramos12@gmail.com,

Wishing everyone the best of health,

Glynis

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

Anything that you can do or give would be most appreciated. Even though we may all be struggling with our expenses, maybe you could just give the smallest amount towards our goal. It's a great many help in even a very small way, we can get there. Please pass on this request to all your contacts, that is a great way to help.Very many thanks for even taking the time to read this request. I don't know anything that I can do in return other than thank you from the bottom of my heart. Any questions you have may be sent to Rebecca at reb.ramos12@gmail.com,Wishing everyone the best of health,GlynisShort SummaryContributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
Introduce yourself and your background.
Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.
Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?What We Need & What You GetBreak it down for folks in more detail:
Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.
The ImpactFeel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:
Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
Make it real for people and build trust.
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Who we are

Give Back International, Inc is a nationally recognized non-profit organization that started as a student group at the University of California, Berkeley in 2008 and has since expanded across the US. As of February 2013 we are licensed as a non-profit organization. 

Our Mission is simple, to provide free medical clinics, supplies and education to underprivileged communities throughout the world. We will accomplish this by sending teams of healthcare professionals to the Dominican Republic, Haiti and other nations with prominent underprivileged communities. By combining medicine and education, Give Back International aims to provide a long-term improvement in healthcare as well as foster a sense of hope in these nations. 

Since our inception we have taken 10 trips to the Dominican Republic and Haiti which have included students and health professionals from UC Berkeley, Cornell, UC Davis and UCLA. To date we have raised over $19,000 and treated over 5,000 patients. 

Dominican Republic Statistics:

-More than 1 in 4 children live in poverty

-Chronic malnutrition affects 1 in 5 pre-school children

-Population: almost 10 million people with 1.5 hospital beds per 1000 people compared with 4 beds per 1000 people in the US

Haiti Statistics:

-78% of Haitians live off less than $2 a day

-50% of children under 5 are malnourished

-AIDS/HIV infects almost 6% of the population compared with 0.5% of the US population

What We Need

Our organization is leading two medical missions to the Dominican Republic this summer with over 30 pre-medical, medical students as well as nurses and physicians. We are raising money to help fund supplies for these trips.

Every penny that we raise is used towards medications and medical supplies on one of our upcoming missions. An example of how your donation can make a difference:

$5 will supply a family of 6 with toothbrushes, toothpaste and soap

$15 will provide essential vitamins for mom and baby for an entire pregnancy

$25 will provide 100 people with treatment for scabies

$50 will supply 50lbs of clothes to a village

Thats right, 100% of donations are used to fund supplies! Each team member must fund their own trip. We want to provide as much medication and supplies to this community.

Although our goal is set at only a $1,000, we hope to surpass that. Each trip we spend roughly $3,500+ on supplies ALONE. Every $1 counts!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate at this time we would greatly appreciate the help by spreading the word about our cause. You can visit us on the web at www.givebackint.org or email us at info@givebackint.org.

story:
• Do you know which are the best remedies for treating this seasons flu? 
  • Are you tired of standing in lines at the pharmacy when you have a fever? 
  • Do you know how many days of fever is normal before contact a doctor? 
  • Do you feel bad for laying in bed eating ice cream for two days?

Flupal+ is the solution for you. So that you can focus on getting better.

Pre-order a Flupal+ now!

Selection of medicines are subject to change. 

See what the big players say about it!

             




Order today. Receive your first Flupal+ in October!

You'll get better when being sick. We will get a better world. And you don't have to go outside to buy nostril spray when you're feeling really sorry for yourself lying in that bed. You save money. You donate to save lives. You get expert advice on how to get better. And its awesome to be first with stuff. Our friend claim that he was among the first 1% to use Hotmail. He brags about it when he is drunk. We cant verify that statement. And he is actually not that awesome. But now you know that. So, what are you waiting for? Please support us. Its not like you're never going to get sick again? You look great today. Like a winner.


  • We want to expand on a global level, but act on a local level
    That means that we will find local remedies in each market we enter to reduce transport & treat with proven meds. It means to find local charities that engage and need help 
  • We want to create what people need
    That does not mean; what people want. People dont necessary know what they want. You dont go to the dentist and complete the act yourself, do you? We listen to what is really the best remedies out there at the moment and portion them with a doctor for best result.
  • We want to do more.
    We find the potential in this project to be huge. And we are open to feedback and suggestions. If you have an idea of how we could help or partner up, please contact us. Joel is unemployed, he can answer emails all day long. No more "Summer of George" for him.
  • We want continue to improve
    Flupal+ should be an experience for you. We want to make your sick time more pleasant were constantly looking for medicines and products. We also look into products and services that could entertain you while you're sick. Do you have any ideas for that? As we said; Joel is going to have a lot of time.

RISK: One risk is that the medical manufacturers have trouble to assemble the product in a fashion that is required for easy shipping and a joyful experience. We have high demands on the end product but also tight margins since we deal with charity. More orders, better bargaining position, better products and more to charity.

SOLUTION: Our secret weapon is a highly respected e-commerce investor in London, Pete. He does not look like the guy on the picture. He is a partner in Flupal and does not like when suppliers dont fulfill their part of the agreement. If this happens, he´ll be on the next flight to the US to sort it out. And he is not afraid of flying. He has so much miles on his frequent-flyer he could fly to the sun. We would like to put his real picture here to raise some trust. But we are not allowed to expose him. He told us he need to kill us if we do so. And he is a lot older and we´re not sure if he knows about sarcasm and all that.

story:
On October 14, 2009 – at seventeen-months old – Nicholas was denied the opportunity of a normal childhood when he was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes.  After a four day pediatric ICU stay, we were given the daily responsibility of making 8-10 potentially life-threatening decisions about his health as we calculate and administer insulin to control his blood sugar levels.

As an active four-year-old, at any moment Nicholas is at risk of experiencing severe hypoglycemia which can lead to coma, brain injury and death.  As parents we’re constantly on high alert and experience enormous stress as a result of living with this always-on, high-stakes lifestyle.  The problem is made worse by a lack of information about what’s going on inside his body.  Today, we test his blood sugar 8-10 times per day by finger prick.  This is considered a very aggressive testing regimen, but still only gives us a limited ability to manage his health.  On a daily basis we experience many test results that are in a normal range, yet he still suffers from wild swings that are too high or too low.  These highs and lows affect his temper, personality, concentration, and can lead to many more severe health consequences.  Fortunately there are tools that can help.

A continuous glucose monitoring system (CGM) is a sensor that tests his blood sugar every five minutes, 24/7.  With a CGM his caregivers would know at all times what his blood sugar levels are, allowing for much better control as well as much less worry, distraction and stress.  The system even predicts oncoming highs and lows and alerts in advance so we can take corrective measures before problems arise.

This fall Nicholas is starting in a full-time Kindergarten program.  It’s critical to his health and success in school that we start him on CGM before then.  Unfortunately, our private health insurer, Excellus BlueCross BlueShield of Rochester has denied him this medical necessity.  Their policy provides CGM coverage for anyone with type 1 diabetes age seven or older and denies coverage to children under age seven.  The basis for their decision to discriminate against the most vulnerable in our society is because CGM has not been clinically proven as an effective treatment for children under seven; however, it has been proven effective in every other age tested.  The reason it hasn’t been proven for children under seven is because no CGM clinical trials have been conducted on children under seven, as clinical trials in children are extremely rare.

“Out-of-pocket” costs for CGM are roughly $4,000 per year, much more than we can afford on our own.  For the last three years we’ve asked friends and family to forgo birthday presents for Nicholas, and instead have all participated in the local JDRF fundraising walk as “Team Birthday Boy” – raising more than $7,500 for diabetes research.  This year we have a more pressing need for your help.  Please consider contributing to this important cause today!

Thank you,

Michael (Nicholas’ Dad)

story:
Our Mission

Our mission is to give the gift of mobility to 550 Jamaicans in 2014. Our volunteer army will assemble and distribute a full container of durable, high quality, free wheelchairs to recipients that are currently crawling or depending on family and friends for their mobility.

What We Need

We need to raise $25,000 to finish funding for a full container of 550 wheelchairs that will be distributed in Jamaica in February 2014. Your donation will fund the production, shipping and delivery of these wheelchairs to good people who desperately need them.  

Your donation picks someone up off the ground and restores their dignity. Your donation takes someone who is currently crawling and gives them the gift of mobility.

What You Get

Most importantly, you’ll receive the joy that comes from reaching out to help another person. You’ll rest assured knowing that your donation went directly to help a fellow human being in desperate need.

When you help, you can choose from a number of rewards, which include Ja'Mobility wristbands, t-shirts, limited edition art and more. Look to the right and choose which reward is right for you. We sincerely appreciate your help!

The Project Details

Ja'Mobility is first and foremost a humanitarian organization and all are invited to join us in our work to reduce suffering through sharing the gift of mobility. We serve and care for our brothers and sisters in Jamaica regardless of race, religion, culture, or gender, and we welcome supporters and volunteers from all backgrounds. 

Our goal is to transform the quality of life not only for the affected individual, but for families, neighborhoods and communities in economically disadvantaged areas of Jamaica.

Ja'mobility was started by Phil Earnhart and Dr. Tony Angelo. After visiting the country and seeing the tremendous need for low-cost wheelchairs, they were moved to find a solution to this problem. They recruited friends, raised funds, and created contacts worldwide to make their dream a reality.  Today, with the help of Free Wheelchair Mission, Ja'Mobility has distributed 550 wheelchairs in each of the last three years and will continue to do so.  

Ja'Mobility utilizes an organizational model that leverages development and support efforts alongside an economical design and a vast network of manufacturing, shipping and distribution partners – the resulting system stretches donor dollars and maximizes beneficial impact.

Please join us in our mission and donate today!

For more information visit  >>> www.JaMobility.com

story:
Stacy Phelps is a 36 year old, beautiful, loving Mother and Wife from a small town in California. She has four beautiful children and a loving husband. Stacy is an active member in her community, very involved with her children's academic life and she is a very outgoing and supportive sport's mom traveling with her children and very seldomly missing a game.

Back in January, Stacy was diagnosed with Cervical Cancer. With treatment and a hysterectomy, she was able to beat it. Unfortunately, less than three months later the cancer had returned and spread and she was diagnosed with life threatening stage 4 cancer. Not willing to give up, The Phelps family did their research and found a hospital in Texas in hopes to get the treatment she needed to beat this cancer as well. Stacy set an appointment with MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston, Texas. Not wanting to leave any member of her family behind, they put on fundraisers and took donations to fund their entire trip to Texas to meet with Doctors and Specialists. After taking tests and scans and seeing Doctors and Specialists, her biggest fear came true, the Doctors there could not help her and gave her a year to live. The cancer is too big and had wrapped around her Colon and Intestines, there is no surgery or treatment that could help stop it. They told her to spend as much time as she can with her family that there is not too much time left.

 After her diagnosis and learning that her time here on Earth will be cut short, her one last wish is to take her family on a vacation before she loses her battle to cancer. She wants to make sure that when the time comes to leave her family behind, her children will remember the good times and not the bad.  Her dream is to take them all to Disney World in Orlando, Florida.

With your donations, you can help Stacy's wish come true. You have an opportunity to help send a beautiful family to a place where they can spend a moment together that is not a constant reminder that their Mother and Wife is losing her battle to cancer, but a place where they can focus on happiness, serenity and peace of mind.  Your contribution will help pay for round trip airfare for a family of 6 from California to Orlando, Florida, 6 days 5 nights in the Disney World Resort, and food, drinks and souveniers for the entire family.

If you don't have PayPal or a Credit Card you can still contribute by sending a check or money order paid to Stacy Phelps (please put "Help the Phelps" in the memo line) to:

Stacy Phelps

P.O. Box 1512

Chester, CA 96020

story:
18U Vista, CA Thrillseekers

The Thrillseekers are headed to Turlock, CA for the Nationals Tournament taking place 7/31-8/5.

  • The team took 3rd place at the States Tournament in Lancaster, CA.
  • Team is made up of girls ranging from 12-18 years of age.
  • The team needs all the girls to reach Turlock to be able to compete effectively.

 

What We Need

We need to raise as much as possible to offset expenses for the team which will assist with:

  • Help offset team expenses such as meals, equipment, travel and lodging.
  • Not having to worry about funding will allow the team to focus on practices and the games to come.
  • Ensures the teams 100% arrival and participation at the tournament.

 

What You Get

The following contributions will receive a perk from the 18U Vista Thrillseekers:

  • $100 Contribution- Will receive an Autographed 8x10 Team Photo.
  • $250 Contribution- Will receive an Autographed Team Ball.
  • $1000 Contribution- Will receive and Autographed Team Jersey.

All contributions of any amount are welcomed as it all will help get the team to Turlock.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please utilize the Indiegogo share tools when spreading the word.

And that’s all there is to it. Many thanks in advance for the assistance in helping the 18U Vista Thrillseekers. Wish Us Luck.

story:
Ce projet vise à financer l’adaptation du logement aux normes handicapées de M. Rached El Arbi, devenu paraplégique suite à une blessure par balle reçue au niveau de la trachée, lors des manifestation spacifiques du 13 janvier 2011. M. El Arbi était alors âgé de 21 ans.

Rached fut donné pour mort après qu'un sniper lui a tiré dessus devant le poste du commissariat du Mornag, dans la banlieue de Tunis. La révolution tunisienne a fait plus de 350 morts et près de 2600 blessés.


M. El Arbi a été inclut dans la liste officielle des « martyrs »  établie par la Commission d’Enquête sur crimes de la révolution, qui peut être téléchargé ici (en arabe): http://archive.mosaiquefm.net/assets/documents/pdf/RAPPORT-04052012.pdf 

La famille El Arbi a donc reçu du gouvernement tunisien, dans le cadre de l’application du décret-loi n°97 relatif aux martyrs et blessés de la révolution, un montant fixe de 6 000 Dinars (environ 2800 EUR), en deux versements, destinés à couvrir les soins médicaux. Ce montant s’est avéré largement insuffisant aux nombreuses interventions médicales nécessaires à la survie de Rached, et la famille s’est donc vue dépendre de l’aide d’acteurs privés (collectes, donations, bénévoles…). M. El Arbi a en effet dû subir plus de 6 opérations depuis 2011. Plus que l'argent, Rached demande pourtant, d'abord, la reconnaissance de son statut de martyr héros de la révolution tunisienne, première du "Printemps Arabe", et de retrouve sa dignité.

En effet, le logement de la famille El Arbi n’est pas adapté à la nouvelle condition de Rached, pour plusieurs raisons (entrée trop étroite, accès aux toilettes impossible, pas de rampe pour la douche…), limitant considérablement son autonomie, et impliquant l’intervention constante de sa mère pour effectuer les gestes les plus simples du quotidien. La vie de la famille a été bouleversée par son handicap. 

Quelques travaux pour adapter le logement de Rached à sa situation pourraient changer la vie de la famille El Arbi. Un devis a été établi à cette fin, pour un montant de 4 000 Dinars au total.  Une ONG tunisienne, "La Ferme Thérapeutique", supervisera ces travaux. Son site est accessible ici: http://www.fth.org.tn/ 

Jusqu’ici, la Ferme Thérapeutique n’a pas encore travaillé directement à l’amélioration des conditions d’habitation des personnes handicapées avec lesquelles elle travaille. Quelques projets ont été menés cependant, en parallèle, par certains employés de la Ferme, leur permettant d’accueillir déjà une certaine expérience dans le suivi de ces projets.

Mener à bien ce projet d’adaptation du logement, dans cette première phase pilote, serait donc une manière de renforcer les capacités de l’association dans ce domaine, en vue de la diversifier par la suite et de pouvoir toucher un plus grand nombre de bénéficiaires. 

Cette première phase pilote sera destinée à évaluer les capacités et les besoins de l’association dans ce domaine. Un bilan sera effectué à cette fin au terme des travaux.

Il existe aujourd’hui 6 blessés de la révolution tunisienne dans la même situation que Rached. L’objectif est d’étendre cette action à chacun, après cette première phase pilote.

La situation de Rached a été présentée dans le cadre du court-métrage produit par la Télévision des Nations Unies: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iDnmuF0njdo

Une petite contribution peut donc suffir pour changer radicalement le quotidien de ces héros qui ont risqué leurs vies pour la liberté, qui méritent la reconnaissance et la dignité!


This project aims at funding home adaptations for disabled wounded of the revolution Rached El Arbi, paraplegic following a gunshot wound received at the trachea during a peaceful demonstration in January 2011. Mr. El Arbi was then 21 years old. 

Rached was given up for dead after a sniper shot him in front of the police station of Mornag, in the suburbs of Tunis. The Tunisian revolution has made more than 350 dead and nearly 2,600 injured. 

Mr. El Arbi was included in the official list of "martyrs" prepared by the Commission of Inquiry into crimes of the revolution, which can be downloaded here (in Arabic): http://archive.mosaiquefm.net/assets/ documents/pdf/RAPPORT-04052012.pdf 

As such, Rached received from the Tunisian government, under the Decree-Law No. 97 on martyrs and wounded of the revolution, a fixed amount of 6,000 dinars (approximately € 2,800) in two installments intended to cover his medical care and as a form of reparation. This amount proved largely insufficient to reimburse the many medical interventions necessary to the survival of Rached, His family was thus forced to depend on the help of private actors ( donations, volunteers ...). Mr. El Arbi has indeed endured more than 6 operations since 2011. However, more than money, what Rached demands is, first, the recognition of his status as a martyr and hero of the Tunisian revolution, the first of the so-called "Arab Spring", and hopes to regain his dignity. 

The home of the El Arbi family indeed is not adapted to the new condition of Rached, for several reasons (the entry is too narrow, there is no direct access to the toilets, no ramp for the shower ...), greatly limiting his autonomy and demanding the constant intervention of his mother to perform the simplest of everyday gestures. The life of the entire family was shattered by his new disability. 

A simple work to adapt Rached's house to his new condition could therefore change the lives of the family El Arbi. An estimate has been established for this purpose, for an amount of 4,000 dinars in total (about 1500 EUR). A Tunisian NGO called "The Therapeutic Farm", specialized in working with people with disabilities, will oversee this work. Their website is available here: http://www.fth.org.tn/ 

So far, the Therapeutic Farm has not worked directly for the improvement of living conditions of people with disabilities. Similar projects have been completed, however, in parallel, by individual employees of the Farm, allowing them to gain some experience in monitoring these projects. 

Carry out this project of adapting Rached's home, in this first pilot phase, would therefore be a way to strengthen the capacity of the organization in this area, and thereafter to reach a larger number of beneficiaries. 

There are now six wounded of the Tunisian revolution in the same situation as Rached. The goal of this project of course is to expand this help to all of them, and give them the dignity they deserve.

Rached situation was presented in this short film produced by the United Nations Television: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iDnmuF0njdo 

A small contribution can therefore be sufficient to radically change the lives of these heroes, who risked their lives for freedom, and who deserve recognition and dignity!

story:
I was very lucky to meet a special strong young lady Rita Yadira on Facebook several years back.

Rita's Facebook Page - https://www.facebook.com/rita.yadira.7?fref=ts

She never complained of her medical situation and made everyone smile on our bird group. After some time of knowing her and seeing some pictures I asked her to write me her medical issues as I wanted to try and help her to pay for medical expenses and hospital. Rita seems to spend more time in hospital than out.

Why I decided to do this as Rita went without her meds for a week and suffered very badly just so she could support other members and her loved pets in her family. She is a very strong willed young lady that thinks about others first.

I know we all have issues in life but even if you could find it in your heart just to donate a few dollars...if we times that by many small donations it will help more than you know.

Rita's Mother is also one amazing woman....

This is not a scam...medical records can be shown if required....

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is what Rita wrote to me -

My name is Rita I was diagnosed with Lupus at the age of 7 when first diagnosed I ended up with pneumonia that turned into a bad case of Pariocarditis which was fluid in the heart lining by my 8th birthday I had open heart surgery to remove fluid. Along with my Lupus I have Rguemotoid arthritis and other things that come along with Lupus such as hypertension Reynaud’s syndrome and insomnia. For most of my life my lupus was controlled with meds but for some reason since 2011 I have been going downhill my senior year of high school I graduated basically from the hospital because I was doing the Benylista infusion once a week which made me feel completely drained then I did my first round of chemo of Ritoximab infusions neither medicine seemed to be able to control my Lupus.

Unfortunately march 2013 the state dropped me from my father’s insurance because I turned 19 so for 6 months I went with no medical attention my Lupus wasn’t monitored or treated properly until one day I gave into going to the hospital because I felt so ill a biopsy of my kidneys showed I now had stage 3/5 Nephritis which meant the Lupus began to attack my kidneys I was devastated my health just seemed to get worse and I have no insurance. I’m in medical debt and only just turned 20 I cannot keep a job because eventually something Lupus related causes me to quit or get fired but I continue to try to work even if its 2-3 months at a time I shouldn’t work I’m told but I try and am fighting SSD with a lawyer thank God for my mother who finances my meds but at times its hard since she is all I have and has a lot of other things on her plate

story:
Hello friends and colleagues,
Yesterday I received an e-mail from Matt's ex-wife with the following information:

"Today marks a big day for Matt Bailey. For the first time since August 2013, he is officially "tube free" and for the last 12 hours breathing completely independently.   Matt entered the hospital on January 14th, almost ten weeks ago. He is by no means out of the woods, but at least he can see the edge of the forest and is in good spirits.    If you would like to call Matt and congratulate him on this accomplishment, I know he would love to talk. Call him even if you don't know him well. He loves talking to everyone. If you didn't know he was in the hospital, call him and he can tell you all about it.   "
212-420-3536  
Beth Israel Medical Center 
First Avenue at 16th Street 10th Floor  
New York, NY 10003

Matt has had several vital organs removed and will need an additional surgery to repair a collapsed lung. He is unable to walk yet and his weight is down to less than 110 pounds. He is looking at an extremely difficult and long recovery and physical rehabilitation.
During Matt's hospital stay, his mother suffered a massive stroke and is in a nursing home back in Pennsylvania. His father passed away a few years back. He has no siblings so my understanding is that this is going to be a very difficult transition for him with no close relatives to depend on.
He is currently not employed and paying the high cost of COBRA. He retains an apartment in Brooklyn. I am informed that he has burned through most of his savings and will be operating at a deficit sooner rather than later.

There are no words I can use to express my sadness and sense of loss I feel for my best friend and work partner. I am absolutely heartbroken. Matt was responsible for the success of many of my sales opportunities, the successes of the companies we worked for, and he enlightened the lives of everyone he met. He and I shared some of the best and worst times together and I will never be able to express the love I have in my heart for him and all he has done for me as my friend and, truly, as my brother.

I know many of you have shared the same experiences and had similar relationships, personal or work, with Matt. I am asking for any amount of financial support you can contribute to make sure Matt has the finances necessary to get through the remaining time of his hospital stay and transitioning back into his apartment which will most likely require adaptations and durable medical equipment. Since he is on COBRA many of his medical costs will be out of pocket and without any remaining savings and his being unemployed, this will be a difficult time. No amount is too small or too large.

However you want to contribute is up to you. If you would like to help pay directly for COBRA or his rent we can certainly arrange it. I believe indiegogo.com is a nice organized way to funnel funds to him though. So please, help us make this transitioning by sharing this site with any friends or former clients to make sure Matt is taken care of during this difficult time. Also, if you are in the city drop by Beth Israel at 1st and 14th to visit. He needs lots of encouragement and happy faces.

story:
Sapao has given us so much

Carlos Sapao is our teacher and mentor, helping us become better people through jiu-jitsu. He has been there with a helping hand when we struggled, and lifted us in the air with a bear hug when we thrived. 

He was next to our brother's bed when he was in a coma, and gave his first black belt to be buried with one of his students. 

His passion, spirit, and dedication both on and off the mat help the world, and those around him, shine a little bit brighter.

Now we can give just a little bit back

He did not ask us to set this up, but a group of his students and friends took it upon ourselves to help his mother's medical care. We are holding a fundraiser event at Columbus Cafe in San Francisco on Thu 6/26 at 8 PM. If you cannot make it and still would like to help, you can make a donation to this campaign.

Even if you are unable to help financially, you can help us spread the word about this campaign, and you can give Sapao a heartfelt hug the next time you cross paths with him.

story:
I want to help my son, and other children like him.

My son is amazing! He is smart, funny, sweet, and loving. But the school system believes there's something wrong with him. I don't! He just happens to see the world from a different perspective!

We've tried so many pills. It seems like 100's! But the one thing they all have in common, is that they hide my son's personality. They change him completely while he's on them. I don't want that!!!  So, I've been doing research to try to find other treatments and therapies to use instead of all these chemicals.

The problem is, I live in a small town. About 7,000 people. I want to be able to travel to other towns. Other libraries. Other treatment facilities. I want to see what other options are out there. And on this journey, I want to raise awareness about children like Brady. In a world where children and parents can accept that not everyone is the same, these kids could be truly happy and flourish!

All I want for my son is for him to be comfortable with who he is. I believe this is a great way to start.

Thank you for your help!!!
